The blind spiritual instinct that tells us obscurely that our owns lives have a particular importance and purpose, and which urges us to find out our vocation, seeks in so doing to bring us to a decision that will dedicate our lives irrevocably to their true purpose. The man who loses this sense of his own personal destiny, and who renounces all hope of having any kind of vocation in life has either lost all hope of happiness or else has entered upon some mysterious vocation that God alone can understand.
author: John Piper, Good News of Great Joy: Daily Readings for Advent

quote: Saying that you are moral because you believe in a god is like saying you are an economist because you play monopoly.
author: Oli Hille, Creating the Perfect Lifestyle

quote: So whom does God wrong in commanding the destruction of the Canaanites? Not the Canaanite adults, for they were corrupt and deserving of judgment. Not the children, for they inherit eternal life. So who is wronged? Ironically, I think the most difficult part of this whole debate is the apparent wrong done to the Israeli soldiers themselves. Can you imagine what it would be like to have to break into some house and kill a terrified woman and her children? The brutalising effect on these Israeli soldiers is disturbing.
author: James Patterson, The Christmas Wedding

quote: [God] is a kind of perpetual critique of instrumental reason.
author: Sorin Cerin, Wisdom Collection

quote: There are no names that do not desire fame because we come from God.
author: Samuel Lee, The Bible and the Closet or How We May Read the Scriptures with the Most Spiritual Profit: And Secret Prayer Successfully Managed

quote: Our life on Earth is nothing but a reflection of the Heaven above. Our mind is the mirror. Sometimes is peaceful and gentle, sometimes it roars and hollows. The clearer it gets, the more you see Heaven in your life. But when the storm rages on, the reflection is gone and it seems that Heaven is nowhere and has never been. Regardless of whether your mind is clear or not, what you must remember is that Heaven is still there.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: Wanasayansi wanasema hakuna Mungu kwa sababu hawawezi kumwona wala kumgusa. Lakini nao hawana akili kwa sababu hawawezi kuiona wala kuigusa.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: The fear of God is an insane idea. God is love and “there is no fear in love, because perfect love casts out all fear.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: Through the door at the end of the hall, Bushrod could see daylight. Gray and sullen it was, but daylight all the same. Through the years Bushrod had seen the dawn come to many fields, after many hard fights, and it was always a sacred moment to him--proof that the universe was still intact in spite of the blood on the ground, the hosts of Departed beginning their first day in eternity, the dead horses and broken gun carriages and scattered equipment--in spite of all the panoramic ruin of the battlefield so brutal and grotesque that it was a wonder God did not bury it in darkness forever--and with it the guilty living, who crept from their holes or their stiff blankets and looked about with astonishment on what they had done. But God never would bury it. He always seemed to want to start over again, whether out of anger or pity Bushrod could not say. And now here was another dawn, after another great fight, and once more God had permitted Bushrod Carter to live.
author: Sabrina Newby

quote: By holding on to God at all times, we can remain calm and enjoy peace in us even in the middle of our storms.
author: Mitch Albom, The First Phone Call from Heaven

quote: Life doesn’t have a singular purpose and yet we try to pigeonhole this infinite gift by searching for a single meaning behind our existence. We hunger for meaning the way a starving man does food—convinced we will waste away without it. As though to experience what it is to be alive weren’t enough to justify drawing breath. Life is a multi-layered practice in exploration, self-definition, connection, and realization. The greatest challenge presented to us as human beings is to allow the infinite to be infinite; to accept that we will always be the student never the teacher, and allow the truths we’ve gathered to evolve because what we seek to understand is a living thing and is in a perpetual state of change. Humanity’s progression of understanding is open-ended. Anyone who professes mastery only shows their ignorance of the infinite procession of enlightenment of which they are a part. Each of us get to add a line into the coverless tome of understanding, which has no beginning and no end.
author: L.M. Browning, Seasons of Contemplation: A Book of Midnight Meditations

quote: The darkness that follows a sunset is never so dark that it can change the inevitability of a sunrise.
author: Philo of Alexandria

quote: The gods say that a man is made the way he is for a purpose, and to seek to alter that is -" "Then let the gods live a day in my skin before they judge me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: Is it not eminently just that I should give myself entirely and without reserve to Him Who drew me out of nothing, and Who at every moment of my life maintains the existence He has given me; Whom I have received all and from Whom I expect all, and without Whom I can never be happy?
author: Jaachynma N.E. Agu, The Best Option

quote: The mystery of the gospel is inexpressible.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: God is the ROCK of all ages.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Righteousness is of God, the righteous Ruler.
author: Lailah Gifty, Akita

quote: Any moral system that is detached from God, no matter how noble and sincerely held, will likewise fail.
author: Dennis Prager, The Ten Commandments: Still the Best Moral Code

quote: God you are so good, you give what we need.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The grandeur of God, the glory of His majesty.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The holy faith is the fear of God.
author: Sunday Adelaja, How To Become Great Through Time Conversion: Are you wasting time, spending time or investing time?

quote: God has saved me in ways i know and in ways i never knew or have discovered.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Birthday of the World and Other Stories

quote: If we desire to be close to Spirit of God, we desire to dwell in clean soul with a clean body.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: John Lennon

quote: In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
author: Confucius

quote: Let no man pull you so low as to hate him.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings

quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,That we may record our emptiness.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
author: Truman Capote

quote: I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?""It is an act too often neglected," said the fox. "It means to establish ties." "To establish ties?" "Just that," said the fox. "To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world....
author: Leo Tolstoy, War and Peace

quote: I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: We learn from failure, not from success!
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: We shall not cease from explorationAnd the end of all our exploringWill be to arrive where we startedAnd know the place for the first time.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton

quote: All knowledge hurts.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell, Wives and Daughters

quote: Risks must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing.
author: Harper Lee, To Kill a Mockingbird

quote: Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist.
author: Francis Bacon, The Essays

quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.
author: Goldie Hawn

quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
author: they stumble that run fast.

quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise.
author: Scott Westerfeld, Uglies

quote: There is an ancient tribal proverb I once heard in India. It says that before we can see properly we must first shed our tears to clear the way.
author: Theodore Roosevelt, Strenuous Life

quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart.
author: Octavia E. Butler

quote: When you look at what C.S. Lewis is saying, his message is so anti-life, so cruel, so unjust. The view that the Narnia books have for the material world is one of almost undisguised contempt. At one point, the old professor says, ‘It’s all in Plato’ — meaning that the physical world we see around us is the crude, shabby, imperfect, second-rate copy of something much better. I want to emphasize the simple physical truth of things, the absolute primacy of the material life, rather than the spiritual or the afterlife.]
author: Daniel Keyes, Flowers for Algernon

quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.
author: Confucius

quote: These violent delights have violent ends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The small wisdom is like water in a glass:clear, transparent, pure.The great wisdom is like the water in the sea:dark, mysterious, impenetrable.
author: John Steinbeck, East of Eden

quote: I do believe in simplicity. It is astonishing as well as sad, how many trivial affairs even the wisest thinks he must attend to in a day; how singular an affair he thinks he must omit. When the mathematician would solve a difficult problem, he first frees the equation of all incumbrances, and reduces it to its simplest terms. So simplify the problem of life, distinguish the necessary and the real. Probe the earth to see where your main roots run.
author: Holly Black, Tithe

quote: There are women who make things better... simply by showing up. There are women who make things happen. There are women who make their way. There are women who make a difference. And women who make us smile. There are women of wit and wisdom who- through strength and courage- make it through. There are women who change the world everyday... Women like you.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.
author: inner peace does not.

quote: It takes a great man to be a good listener.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: It is easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.
author: Kristin Cashore, Bitterblue

quote: The happiness of the drop is to die in the river.
author: John Russell

quote: I will not deny but that the best apology against false accusers is silence and sufferance, and honest deeds set against dishonest words.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Books permit us to voyage through time, to tap the wisdom of our ancestors. The library connects us with the insight and knowledge, painfully extracted from Nature, of the greatest minds that ever were, with the best teachers, drawn from the entire planet and from all our history, to instruct us without tiring, and to inspire us to make our own contribution to the collective knowledge of the human species. I think the health of our civilization, the depth of our awareness about the underpinnings of our culture and our concern for the future can all be tested by how well we support our libraries.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: But if you believe yourself worthy of the thing you fought so hard to get, then you become an instrument of God, you help the Soul of the World, and you understand why you are here.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: In fact, the mere act of opening the box will determine the state of thecat, although in this case there were three determinate states the catcould be in: these being Alive, Dead, and Bloody Furious.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: You are an explorer, and you represent our species, and the greatest good you can do is to bring back a new idea, because our world is endangered by the absence of good ideas. Our world is in crisis because of the absence of consciousness.
author: but the fact that he can do wrong proves his moral inferiority to any creatures that cannot.

quote: He who is certain he knows the ending of things when he is only beginning them is either extremely wise or extremely foolish; no matter which is true, he is certainly an unhappy man, for he has put a knife in the heart of wonder.
author: Confucius

quote: The nail that sticks out farthest gets hammered the hardest.
author: Harry Truman

quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
author: still many things I understand.

quote: Travel brings wisdom only to the wise. It renders the ignorant more ignorant than ever.
author: Black Elk

quote: Sometimes wisdom came from strange places, even from giant teenaged goldfish.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: We need not take refuge in supernatural gods to explain our saints and sages and heroes and statesmen, as if to explain our disbelief that mere unaided human beings could be that good or wise.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
author: the more knowledge the more grief.

quote: Men have two greatest fears: the first fear is the fear of being needed, and the second fear is the fear of not being needed.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
author: Mario Andretti

quote: Liberty without Learning is always in peril and Learning without Liberty is always in vain.
author: J. Sterling, The Perfect Game

quote: Veganism is not about giving anything up or losing anything
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Lucy: You learn more when you lose Charlie Brown: Well then I must be the smartest person in world!!!
author: Pittacus Lore, I Am Number Four

quote: Suppose that we are wise enough to learn and know—and yet not wise enough to control our learning and knowledge, so that we use it to destroy ourselves? Even if that is so, knowledge remains better than ignorance. It is better to know—even if the knowledge endures only for the moment that comes before destruction—than to gain eternal life at the price of a dull and swinish lack of comprehension of a universe that swirls unseen before us in all its wonder. That was the choice of Achilles, and it is mine, too.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: youth is easily deceived because it is quick to hope.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: Adventure is not outside man
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: It is beautiful to express love and even more beautiful to feel it.
author: Voltaire

quote: A path is made by walking on it.
author: Simone de Beauvoir, The Second Sex

quote: If a man could have half of his wishes, he would double his troubles.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Being alive is sign of strength!
author: Dejan Stojanovic, The Shape

quote: Every form of art is another way of seeing the world. Another perspective, another window. And science –that’s the most spectacular window of all. You can see the entire universe from there.
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: Life is like a sandwich!Birth as one slice,and death as the other.What you put in-between the slices is up to you.Is your sandwich tasty or sour?Allan Rufus.org
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: There are many goals but one path - the path of compassion.
author: Brandon Sanderson, The Way of Kings

quote: I feel with some passion that what we truly are is private, and almost infinitely complex, and ambiguous, and both external and internal, and double- or triple- or multiply natured, and largely mysterious even to ourselves; and furthermore that what we are is only part of us, because identity, unlike "identity", must include what we do. And I think that to find oneself and every aspect of this complexity reduced in the public mind to one property that apparently subsumes all the rest ("gay", "black", "Muslim", whatever) is to be the victim of a piece of extraordinary intellectual vulgarity.
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: I believe much trouble and blood would be saved if we opened our hearts more.
author: Michael Crichton, Eaters of the Dead

quote: Morality is temporary, wisdom is permanent.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
author: Inga Muscio, Cunt: A Declaration of Independence

quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: We understand more than we know.
author: Scott Lynch, The Lies of Locke Lamora

quote: It seems wisest to assume the worst from the beginning...and let anything better come as a surprise.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: A point of view can be a dangerous luxury when substituted for insight andunderstanding.
author: Johnny Depp

quote: We need houses as we need clothes, architecture stimulates fashion. It’s like hunger and thirst — you need them both.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You see, the best thing about wrong decisions is that they don’t prevent you from making the right decisions later on. It’s harder, but it’s not impossible.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
author: Natsuki Takaya

quote: Experience teaches us that it is much easier to prevent an enemy from posting themselves than it is to dislodge them after they have got possession.
author: Wallace Stegner, The Spectator Bird

quote: The truth is always something that is told, not something that is known. If there were no speaking or writing, there would be no truth about anything. There would only be what is.
author: R.L. LaFevers, Dark Triumph

quote: Every intelligent individual wants to know what makes him tick, and yet is at once fascinated and frustrated by the fact that oneself is the most difficult of all things to know.
author: Marilyn Vos Savant

quote: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

quote: I call that man awake who, with conscious knowledge and understanding, can perceive the deep unreasoning powers in his soul, his whole innermost strength, desire and weakness, and knows how to reckon with himself.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: I am so wise I had my mouth sewn shut.
author: Marissa Meyer, Cress

quote: There is no such uncertainty as a sure thing.
author: Dion Boucicault

quote: Wise men profit more by fools than fools by wise men.
author: Miyamoto Musashi, A Book of Five Rings: The Classic Guide to Strategy

quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man
author: Confucius

quote: Obstacles are those frightening things you see when you take you eyes off your goal.
author: Dale Carnegie, How to Win Friends and Influence People

quote: When Don Quixote went out into the world, that world turned into a mystery before his eyes. That is the legacy of the first European novel to the entire subsequent history of the novel. The novel teaches us to comprehend the world as a question. There is wisdom and tolerance in that attitude.
author: Eckhart Tolle, The Power of Now

quote: If you want to fly on the sky, you need to leave the earth. If you want to move forward, you need to let go the past that drags you down.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Fashion and music are the same, because music express its period too.
author: David Leonhardt

quote: The mermaid is an archetypal image that represents a woman who is at ease in the great waters of life, the waters of emotion and sexuality. She shows us how to embrace our instinctive sexuality and sensuality so that we can affirm the essence of our feminine nature, the wisdom of our bodies, and the playfulness of our spirits. She symbolizes our connection with our deepest instinctive feelings, our wild and untamed animal nature that exists below the surface of outward personalities. She is able to respond to her mysterious sexual impulses without abandoning her more human, conscious side. What happened to the girls who dreamed of being mermaids?
author: Jalaluddin Rumi, Love: The Joy That Wounds: The Love Poems of Rumi

quote: I believe that maturity is not an outgrowing, but a growing up: that an adult is not a dead child, but a child who survived. I believe that all the best faculties of a mature human being exist in the child. . . . that one of the most deeply human, and humane, of these faculties is the power of imagination.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Age is a hell of a price to pay for wisdom
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: he who will not economize will have to agonize
author: Amit Ray, Nonviolence: The Transforming Power

quote: At the end of the day, the questions we ask of ourselves determine the type of people that we will become.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: A clear vision, backed by definite plans, gives you a tremendous feeling of confidence and personal power.
author: Thomas McGuane

quote: All that sadness. All that anger. It is the smoke that gets into your eyes. If you do not blow it away, how can you hope to see?
author: it cannot be justified with respect to nonhumans—however “humanely” we treat them.

quote: Behaviour is a mirror in which every one displays his own image.
author: William Shakespeare, Hamlet

quote: If everyone helps to hold up the sky, then one person does not become tired.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, Crime and Punishment

quote: Wit seduces by signaling intelligence without nerdiness.
author: Baltasar Gracián

quote: Knowledge is marvelous, but wisdom is even better.
author: Aesop

quote: Your biggest opportunity probably lies under your own feet, in your current job, industry, education, experience or interests.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love

quote: The individual appears for an instant, joins the community of thought, modifies it and dies; but the species, that dies not, reaps the fruit of his ephemeral existence.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, Eat, Pray, Love

quote: Science is observing truth in the light of head. Religion is observing truth in the light of heart. Humanity is using both the lights. And education is developing that humanity.
author: Hlovate, Rooftop Rant

quote: A person is a person through other persons.None of us comes into the world fully formed. We would not know how to think, or walk, or speak, or behave as human beings unless we learned it from other human beings. We need other human beings in order to be human. I am because other people are. A person is entitled to a stable community life, and the first of these communities is the family.
author: Joseph Bruchac

quote: Ask not of things to shed their veils. Unveil yourselves, and things will be unveiled.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: To risk life to save a smile on a face of a woman or a child is the secret of chivalry.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: A wise person does at once, what a fool does at last. Both do the same thing; only at different times.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: In a dark time, the eye begins to see.
author: P.C. Cast, Burned

quote: La rutina no está tanto en las cosas como en nuestra incapacidad para crear a cada momento un vínculo original con ellas, en nuestra tendencia a leerlas por la falsilla de lo rutinario, de lo ya aprendido. Hay que seguir dejando siempre abierta la puerta al cuarto de jugar.
author: Baltasar Gracián, The Art of Worldly Wisdom

quote: The use of sea and air is common to all; neither can a title to the ocean belong to any people or private persons, forasmuch as neither nature nor public use and custom permit any possession therof.
author: Wayne W. Dyer

quote: Who does ever get what they want? It doesn’t seem to happen to many of us if any at all. It’s always two people bumping against each other blindly, acting out old ideas and dreams and mistaken understandings.
author: J.D. Stroube, Caged in Darkness

quote: …a man should say to his soul every morning, "God has given thee twenty-four treasures; take heed lest thou lose anyone of them, for thou wilt not be able to endure the regret that will follow such loss.
author: Ellen Goodman

quote: Most women had the one thing in common: they had great pain when they gave birth to their children. This should make a bond that held them all together
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Not all men (and especially the wisest) share the opinion that it is bad for women to be educated. But it is very true that many foolish men have claimed this because it displeased them that women knew more than they did.
author: Isaac Asimov, Pebble in the Sky

quote: You have a great heart, but will only find it to be so through great pain. This is the wisdom of love, and its doubtful gift. . . . I have endured much suffering and still remain unbitter and unclosed.
author: Andy Andrews, The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective

quote: After all Death is a Symbol that there was Life.
author: Brian Tracy, Focal Point: A Proven System to Simplify Your Life, Double Your Productivity, and Achieve All Your Goals

quote: Develop the winning edge
author: Sarah Addison Allen

quote: But goodness alone is never enough. A hard, cold wisdom is required for goodness to accomplish good. Goodness without wisdom always accomplishes evil.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Routine feeds the illusion of safety...
author: Charles Kingsley, The Water-Babies

quote: At times anger will trigger harsh words. After a cooling period wisdom sets in; finally, the ability to speak from the heart with love and compassion.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.

quote: After his experience with Minos, Nico realized that most spectres held only as much power as you allowed them to have. They pried into your mind, using fear or anger or longing to influence you. Nico had learned to shield himself. Sometimes he could even turn the tables and bend ghosts to his will.
author: A.A. Milne, The House at Pooh Corner

quote: Wisdom. . .is knowing what you have to accept.
author: Charles Yu, How to Live Safely in a Science Fictional Universe

quote: You see, to find the brightest wisdom one must pass through the darkest zones. And through the darkest zones there can be no guide. No guide, that is, but courage
author: Yvon Chouinard, Let My People Go Surfing: The Education of a Reluctant Businessman

quote: If you are driven by fear, anger or pride nature will force you to compete. If you are guided by courage, awareness, tranquility and peace nature will serve you.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: The more you look into and understand yourself, the less judgmental you become towards others.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: There are two words that you should use frequently in your youth: ´sorry´ and ´thank-you´. Use the first one as often as possible, so that on your death bed all that you have to say to your friends is ´thank-you!´.
author: Harriet Evans, Happily Ever After

quote: It is born in mind that the tragedy of life does not lie in not reaching the goal. The tragedy of life lies in having no goal to reach.
author: Clarence Darrow, Why I Am An Agnostic and Other Essays

quote: The idea of authority, which they represented, was associated in our minds with a greater insight and a more humane wisdom.
author: Rick Riordan, The Blood of Olympus

quote: He who binds to himself a joyDoes the winged life destroy
author: Amor Towles, Rules of Civility

quote: There are two kinds of fools. One says, "This is old, and therefore good." And one says, " This is new, and therefore better.
author: Laura Munson, This Is Not The Story You Think It Is: A Season of Unlikely Happiness

quote: Lady Wisdom will be your close friend
author: Zora Neale Hurston, Dust Tracks on a Road

quote: In life, the hardest decisions often have to be made more than once. But each time, it gets easier.
author: Lloyd Alexander, The High King

quote: The best way to see Faith is to shut the eye of Reason.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quote: It is not until you change your identity to match your life blueprint that you will understand why everything in the past never worked.
author: Traci Harding, The Dragon Queens

quote: They say you should know your limits and work within them. But how can you really know your limits unless you try to expand them?
author: Eddie  Johnson

quote: The weak are dominated by their ego, the wise dominate their ego, and the intelligent are in a constant struggle against their ego.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: To know when to be generous and when firm—that is wisdom.
author: Carole Wilkinson, Dragon Keeper

quote: Success equals goals
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: When I start a new seminar I tell my students that I will undoubtedly contradict myself, and that I will mean both things. But an acceptance of contradiction is no excuse for fuzzy thinking. We do have to use our minds as far as they will take us, yet acknowledge that they cannot take us all the way.
author: Anna Gould

quote: Night is certainly more novel and less profane than day.
author: Anthony de Mello, One Minute Wisdom

quote: Wordsare powerfulforces of nature.they are destruction.they are nourishment. they are flesh. they are water.they are flowers and bone.they burn. they cleansethey erase. they etch. they can eitherleave youfeelinghomelessor brimmingwith home.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

quote: Our wisdom comes from our experience,and our experience comes from our foolishness.
author: Andy Andrews, The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective

quote: Men must endureTheir going hence, even as their coming hither.Ripeness is all.
author: Jaeda DeWalt

quote: Perhaps the hardest lesson to learn is not to be attached to the results of your actions.
author: George Jones

quote: Perhaps there is supranatural: reason beyond the normal definitions of fact or data-based logic
author: Graham Greene, Loser Takes All

quote: I remember my youth and the feeling that will never come back any more /the feeling that I could last for ever, outlast the sea, the earth, and all men; the deceitful feeling that lures us on to joys, to perils, to love, to vain effort /to death; the triumphant conviction of strength, the heat of life in the handful of dust, the glow in the heart that with every year grows dim, grows cold, grows small, and expires /and expires, too soon, too soon /before life itself
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: People of limited intelligence are fond of talking about "these days," imagining that they have discovered and appraised the peculiarities of "these days" and that human nature changes with the times.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: The notion of freedom proclaimed by the modern world is anti-discipline. But true freedom cannot be separated from discipline.
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: But what minutes! Count them by sensation, and not by calendars, and each moment is a day.
author: CrimethInc., Evasion

quote: In the long run what people think about shepherds and bakers becomes more important for them than their own destinies.
author: Michael Anderson

quote: Wisdom says we are nothing. Love says we are everything. Between these two our life flows.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quote: Wise men talk because they have something to say; Fools, because they have to say something.
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: The operation of the Church is entirely set up for the sinner; which creates much misunderstanding among the smug.”(August 9, 1955)
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
author: Christopher Paolini, Eldest

quote: For my own part, I tend to find the doctrinal books often more helpful in devotion than the devotional books, and I rather suspect that the same experience may await others. I believe that many who find that ‘nothing happens’ when they sit down, or kneel down, to a book of devotion, would find that the heart sings unbidden while they are working their way through a tough bit of theology with a pipe in their teeth and a pencil in their hand.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: What should I do—how should I act now, this very day . . . What she would resolve to do that day did not yet seem quite clear, but something that she could achieve stirred her as with an approaching murmur which would soon gather distinctness.
author: John Connolly, The Infernals

quote: Never read a book through merely because you have begun it.
author: Stefan Molyneux

quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: there is only one way under high heaven to get the best of an argument - and that is to avoid it .
author: Audre Lorde

quote: Talk is free but the wise man chooses when to spend his words.
author: Sharon Salzberg, The Power of Meditation: A 28-Day Programme for Real Happiness

quote: Veganism is an act of nonviolent defiance. It is our statement that we reject the notion that animals are things and that we regard sentient nonhumans as moral persons with the fundamental moral right not to be treated as the property or resources of humans.
author: Anonymous, Holy Bible: New International Version

quote: Love begets wisdom, thus it is, as often misconceived, more than vain layers of tenderness; it is inherently rational and comprehensive of the problem within the problem: for instance, envy is one of the most excused sins in the media of political correctness. Those you find most attractive, or seem to have it all, are often some of the most insecure at heart, and that is because people assume that they do not need anything but defamation.
author: Sanober  Khan, Turquoise Silence

quote: Listen. Pay attention. Treasure every moment.
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: The compassionate person does not require other people to be stupid, in order to be intelligent. Their intelligence is for everyone, so as to have a world in which there is less ignorance. (118)
author: Paul Brunton

quote: The main thing about ghosts – most of them have lost their voices. In Asphodel, millions of them wander around aimlessly, trying to remember who they were. You know why they end up like that? Because in life they never took a stand one way or another. They never spoke out, so they were never heard. Your voice is your identity. If you don’t use it,’ Nico said with a shrug, ‘you’re halfway to Asphodel already.’…He hated when his own advice applied to himself.
author: Vera Nazarian, The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration

quote: Before the fruits of prosperity can come, the storms of life need to first bring the required rains of testing, which mixes with the seeds of wisdom to produce a mature harvest.
author: Walt Whitman, Song of Myself

quote: Aeschylus writes, "In our sleep, pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom through the awful grade of God.
author: Ann Patchett, What Now?

quote: The failure mode of clever is “asshole.
author: Ozzie Zehner, Green Illusions

quote: I love you , Valentine’ is actually a popular phrase used in greeting cards.”If you were sending me one, what would it say?” he asks.I love you, too, Roman.”And there it is, words that I dread to say and do mean, because with them comes the responsibility of owning it, moving forward together and deciding for real who we are to each other. Now we’re not just lovers discovering what we like and sharing what we know. In this mutual declaration, we’re accountable to each other. We’re in love, and now, our relationship has to build slowly and beautifully in order to hold all the joy and misery that lies ahead.
author: Chuck Klosterman, Sex, Drugs, and Cocoa Puffs: A Low Culture Manifesto

quote: I would have liked to come into the grocery some morning and see them all, even the Elberts and the children, lying there crying with the pain of dying. I would help myself to groceries, I thought, stepping over their bodies, taking whatever I fancied from the shelves, and go home, with perhaps a kick for Mrs.Donell while she lay there. I was never sorry when I had thoughts like this; I only wished they would come true.
author: Homer, The Iliad

quote: You must become the producer, director and actor in the unfolding story of your life.
author: Isaiah Berlin

quote: Those who try to juggle wisdom, power and greed, drop one of the balls, every time.”—Zarost
author: L.J. Smith, Witchlight

quote: People love answers, but only as long as they are the ones who came up with them.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Women particularly should concern themselves with peace because men by nature are more foolhardy and headstrong, and their overwhelming desire to avenge themselves prevents them from foreseeing the resulting dangers and terrors of war. But woman by nature is more gentle and circumspect. Therefore, if she has sufficient will and wisdom she can provide the best possible means to pacify man.
author: Lish McBride, Necromancing the Stone

quote: We must not only obtain Wisdom: we must enjoy her.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Cheap booze is a false economy.
author: Joe Vigil

quote: To come to nothing through something is the way to outside from both sides.
author: Tina Carreiro, Power of the Moon

quote: ...ducks and geese are foolish things, and must be looked after, but girls can take care of themselves.
author: Pablo

quote: Life changes us. To wish otherwise is pointless.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Silence is the universal refuge, the sequel to all dull discourses and all foolish acts, a balm to our every chagrin, as welcome after satiety as after disappointment; that background which the painter may not daub, be he master or bungler, and which, however awkward a figure we may have made in the foreground, remains ever our inviolable asylum, where no indignity can assail, no personality can disturb us.
author: Mortimer J. Adler, How to Read a Book: The Classic Bestselling Guide to Reading Books and Accessing Information

quote: The intelligent have plans
author: Omar Khayyám

quote: The pleasures arising from thinking and learning will make us think and learn all the more. 1153a 23
author: Marva J. Dawn, Keeping the Sabbath Wholly: Ceasing, Resting, Embracing, Feasting

quote: Spend your leisure time in cultivating an ear attentive to discourse, for in this way you will find that you learn with ease what others have found out with difficulty.
author: Sogyal Rinpoche

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; Skill is knowing how to do it, and Virtue is doing it.
author: the best occupations are the least forced.

quote: FOCUS = Follow On Course Until Successful.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Humans will never be in charge of this world, as long as dust and weeds do as they please.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Not what happens to youBut how you accept itIs of paramount importance.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Those who possess wisdom cannot just ladle it out to every wantwit and jackanapes who comes along and asks for it. A person must be prepared to receive wisdom, or else it will do him more harm than good. Moreover, a lout thrashing about in the clear waters of wisdom will dirty those waters for everyone else.
author: Euripides

quote: Wisdom does not make me full. It fills me with hunger.
author: Dorothy Parker, Constant Reader

quote: A WORD TO THE WISELet the world pass in its time-ridden race; never get caught in its snare.Remember, the only acceptable casefor being in any particular place is having no business there.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: You have to be ill if you want to get better.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Worry is a down payment on a problem you may never have
author: Roopleen

quote: When it came to adults, it was better not to talk. They had a way of hearing one thing and processing it as something else. No reason to give them an excuse to hurt you.
author: for it brings everything to light.

quote: Some people today are wandering generalities instead of meaningful specifics because they have failed to discover and mine the wealth of potentials in them.
author: Amanda Hocking, Wisdom

quote: We don’t know anything about silent sages, buried knowledge, the eye of the mute poet, serene seers, yet how many talkative destroyers, prophets and ideologues, teachers and beautifiers there are on the other side.
author: Rumiko Takahashi

quote: Man masters nature not by force, but by understanding
author: James Caan

quote: Wise men speak only of what they know
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: When mind exists undisturbed in the Way, nothing in the world can offend, and when a thing can no longer offend it ceases to exist in the old way. When no discriminating thoughts arise, the old mind ceases to exist.
author: Quintus Aurelius Symmachus

quote: People as a rule do mean much more than they understand.
author: Sallust

quote: If you dwell in the darkness, you can see in the dark and look into the light. But in choosing the darkness, you know you are destined to walk alone.
author: Arthur Rimbaud

quote: Seek to learn constantly while you live
author: Sarah Jessica Parker

quote: The only thing more dangerous than ignorance is the pretense of intelligent ignorance. The former is teachable
author: Munia Khan

quote: Tis easier to suppress the first desire than to satisfy all that follow it.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke, Letters to a Young Poet

quote: When you love you give meaning to this world.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: I almost think there is no wisdom comparable to that of exchanging what is called the realities of life for dreams
author: Alexander McCall Smith, The World According to Bertie

quote: Self-education is lifelong curiosity.
author: Deepak Chopra, The Book of Secrets: Unlocking the Hidden Dimensions of Your Life

quote: Look no farther than your hand,Make a choice and take a stand.
author: Donita K. Paul, DragonKnight

quote: What deep wounds ever closed without a scar?The hearts bleed longest, and heals but to wear That which disfigures it.
author: Mark Carwardine, Last Chance to See

quote: I came to set fire to the earth. And I am watchful that the fire grow.May the fire of love grow in our hearts.
author: Aaron Cohen

quote: Be a craftsman in speech that thou mayest be strong, for the strength of one is the tongue, and speech is mightier than all fighting.
author: Seneca

quote: He felt a little lost, after that experience. Lost as the girls on their knees. It was a never-ending story of young girls losing themselves, such that they were no longer humans with any souls or characters, but pretty girls with fat asses and nice tits.
author: Vernon Howard

quote: Peace is not an easy prospect--it requires greater bravery than does conflict.
author: J.D. Salinger, The Catcher in the Rye

quote: Progress is a natural result of staying focused on the process of doing anything.
author: Amanda Hocking, Wisdom

quote: The source of wisdom and power, of love and beauty, is within ourselves, but not within our egos. It is within our consciousness. Indeed, its presence provides us with a conscious contrast which enables us to speak of the ego as if it were something different and apart: it is the true Self whereas the ego is only an illusion of the mind.
author: Baltasar Gracián

quote: You will meet many opponents in your time that will come face to face with your flaws, trust the chaos ~ pain & confusion is the pathway to break open and become free.
author: Ralph Alfred Habas, The Art of Self-Control

quote: Integrity is the lifeblood of democracy.Deceit is a poison in its veins.
author: Ann Rinaldi, Numbering All the Bones

quote: Compassion for others is a mark of wisdom.
author: Ralph Alfred Habas, The Art of Self-Control

quote: I am not the river I am the net.
author: Ana Monnar

quote: A statement made from the heart has an aroma, it has lights, it has earth andsun and moon. It is colorful and it grasps the attention of those around you,like the sunset.
author: Ralph Alfred Habas, The Art of Self-Control

quote: Don’t cry and don’t rage. Understand.
author: Barbara Kingsolver, Small Wonder

quote: It is not really hard to do nothing. Many can. The hard part is doing nothing without feeling guilty about it.
author: Abigail Van Buren

quote: While wisdom dictates the need for education, education does not necessarily make one wise.
author: Romain Rolland, Jean Christophe Vol I

quote: Definitions from Mulla Do-PiazaA fool:
author: Trent Zelazny

quote: Love between man and woman cannot be built without sacrifices and self-denial.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: You may die a hundred deaths without a break in the mental turmoil. Or, you may keep your body and die only in the mind. The death of the mind is the birth of wisdom.
author: Esther Hicks

quote: When you feel life at crossroads,you need higher perspective view.
author: Charles Alexander Eastman, The Soul of the Indian

quote: The only way you would have failed," she said, "is if you had.
author: Anonymous, The Arabian Nights

quote: Let your wisdom guide youOn your own personal journey By listening to your heartYour soul will be alight And let you beAll that you are intended to be
author: Jean-Yves Leloup, Compassion and Meditation: The Spiritual Dynamic between Buddhism and Christianity

quote: If you seem to be happy in this place of solitude, you will acquire a great reputation for wisdom, and I know, by my own experience, that under the cloak of a great reputation it is possible to hide whole treasures of folly. (“The Story of Princess Zulkais and the Prince Kalilah”)
author: Jayleigh Cape

quote: Thirty-nine years of my life had passed before I understood that clouds were not my enemy; that they were beautiful, and that I needed them. I suppose this, for me, marked the beginning of wisdom. Life is short.
author: Raheel Farooq

quote: There is a power in nature that man has ignored. And the result has been heartache and pain.
author: Milton Glaser

quote: Every creature was designed to serve a purpose. Learn from animals for they are there to teach you the way of life. There is a wealth of knowledge that is openly accessible in nature. Our ancestors knew this and embraced the natural cures found in the bosoms of the earth. Their classroom was nature. They studied the lessons to be learned from animals. Much of human behavior can be explained by watching the wild beasts around us. They are constantly teaching us things about ourselves and the way of the universe, but most people are too blind to watch and listen.
author: Toba Beta, Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza

quote: I would much rather be considered wise than smart. But, I still think it is wise to get an education.
author: Archilochos, Carmina Archilochi: The Fragments of Archilochos

quote: Collaboration has no hierarchy. The Sun collaborates with soil to bring flowers on the earth.
author: Judy Gold

quote: Any man who behaves arrogantly with what little he knows, or claims to know all, only reveals to all that he really knows nothing. Real greatness does not reside inside those who feel large. The truly wise are meek.
author: Joshua Caleb

quote: L’arbre tombe feuille à feuille : si les hommes contemplaient chaque matin ce qu’ils ont perdu la veille, ils s’apercevraient bien de leur pauvreté.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Bengal Tigress: A Treatise on Gender Equality

quote: Kindness and awareness work together. Through awareness we understand the underlying beauty of everything and every being.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Being the light of the world is about being a broken, exploding, scarred star and shining a light of hope and inspiration to everyone around you.
author: Idries Shah, The Commanding Self

quote: The way into the hall of success always passes through the chamber of decision. Decide to be a success
author: John Steinbeck, Travels with Charley: In Search of America

quote: Wisdom is when you understand what, previously, at best you only knew.
author: Tony Vigorito

quote: One who never anticipates deceit or expects duplicity, and yet is the first to recognize such things – is that not a sage indeed?
author: Confucius, The Analects

quote: Opportunity is swift of flight but slow to return.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: humility is beyond our reach. if it were a product of reaching, we would instinctively be proud of reaching it. it is a gift.
author: Ueda Akinari, Tales of Moonlight and Rain

quote: To say that a being who is sentient has no interest in continuing to live is like saying that a being with eyes has no interest in continuing to see. Death—however “humane”—is a harm for humans and nonhumans alike.
author: Harold S. Kushner

quote: Creating a better futureRequires creativity in the present.
author: Euripides

quote: Animals are property. There are laws that supposedly protect animal interestsin being treated “humanely,” but that term is interpreted in large part to mean that we cannot impose “unnecessary” harm on animals, and that is measured by what treatment is considered as necessary within particular industries, and according to customs of use, to exploit animals. The bottom line is that animals do not have any respect-based rights in the way that humans have, because we do not regard animals as having any moral value. They have only economic value. We value their interests economically, and we ignore their interests when it is economically beneficial for us to do so.At this point in time, it makes no sense to focus on the law, because as long as we regard animals as things, as a moral matter, the laws will necessarily reflect that absence of moral value and continue to do nothing to protect animals. We need to change social and moral thinking about animals before the law is going to do anything more.
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: The job of a writer is not to convey emotion but to invoke it.
author: R. Alan Woods, The Journey Is The Destination: A Photo Journal

quote: Make your ideal your new real.
author: Herman Melville, Moby-Dick or, The Whale

quote: From the cradle to the grave, joy and pain is the fertilizer for wisdom.
author: Jennifer Donnelly, A Northern Light

quote: Whenever ego suffers from fear of death & your practice turns to seeing impermanence, ego settles down.
author: Henry David Thoreau, Life Without Principle

quote: Be wise as a serpent and wary as a dove!
author: Dick Francis, Crossfire

quote: The brillant person who does not take heed is the same as the ignorant who does not know.
author: Robertson Davies, A Mixture of Frailties

quote: all brave men love
author: Amanda Hocking, Wisdom

quote: To live content with small means; to seek elegance rather than luxury, and refinement rather than fashion; to be worthy, not respectable, and wealthy, not, rich; to listen to stars and birds, babes and sages, with open heart; to study hard; to think quietly, act frankly, talk gently, await occasions, hurry never; in a word, to let the spiritual, unbidden and unconscious, grow up through the common. this is my symphony.
author: Sengcan, Hsin Hsin Ming

quote: One true king knew when to step aside and give up the reins of power—to remove his crown and relinquish his kingdom—all for the sake of glimpsing, just once in a lifetime, the face of a holy child.He was the Fourth to follow the Star.His gift was a secret.The rest of his journey is unknown.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: To have opinions is to sell out to yourself. To have no opinion is to exist. To have every opinion is to be a poet.
author: Oakley Hall, Warlock

quote: Right now, just speak gently your words of wisdom to the youngsters.Sooner or later, those words will arrive at the right place in their hearts.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: ...freedom can be a full-time job if you let it.
author: Toba Beta, My Ancestor Was an Ancient Astronaut

quote: I wrote "David" because it seemed to me that children, who can love a book more passionately than any grown person, got such a lot of harmless entertainment and not enough real, valuable literature.
author: Nyogen Senzaki

quote: To be beyond yourself is the gate to wisdom.
author: Sorin Cerin

quote: Expectation has brought me disappointment. Disappointment has brought me wisdom. Acceptance, gratitude and appreciation have brought me joy and fulfilment.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: A primary requirement in every enterprise in habit-formation is self-confidence.
author: Arkady Strugatsky

quote: For what are in reality the things we call ‘Wisdom,’ ‘Virtue,’ ‘Heroism,’ ‘sublime hours,’ and ‘great moments of life,’ but the moments when we have more or less issued forth from ourselves, and have been able to halt, be it only for an instant, on the step of one of the eternal gates whence we see that the faintest cry, the most colourless thought, and most nerveless gestures do not drop into nothingness; …
author: Mark Twain

quote: Never underestimate yourself when you do what is right. Never overestimate yourself when you do what is wrong.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Die Welt ist von Narren geschaffen, damit Weise in ihr Leben.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
author: Sigrid Undset, The Axe

quote: The greatest solution of all is to live and work in partnership with yourself, your family and friends, your work and community, your nation, your world, nature, and spirit.
author: Voltaire, Candide and The Maid of Orleans

quote: His strength for your weakness! His wisdom for your folly! His drive for your drift! His grace for your greed! His love for your lust! His peace for your problems! His joy for your sorrow! His plenty for your poverty!
author: Randall Jarrell, The Complete Poems

quote: Selfishness and greed, individual or national, cause most of our troubles.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You call forth the world which God has formed and that world only. Nor is this life of yours by which you set such store your doing, however you may choose to tell it. Its shape was forced in the void at the onset and all talk of what might otherwise have been is senseless for there is no otherwise. Of what could it be made? Where be hid? Or how make its appearance? The probability fo the actual is absolute. That we have no power to guess it out beforehand makes it no less certain. That we may imagine alternate histories means nothing at all.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Feel not obliged to make good use of every ripe fruit on the vine.
author: Megan  Webster

quote: Any serious social, political, and economic change must include veganism.
author: Margaret Atwood, The Year of the Flood

quote: Don’t hide what you have just because people tell you it’s not normal. I have known normal people…and guess what? They are as boring as hell...
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: If we take the position that an assessment that veganism is morally preferable to vegetarianism is not possible because we are all “on our own journey,” then moral assessment becomes completely impossible or is speciesist. It is impossible because if we are all “on our own journey,” then there is nothing to say to the racist, sexist, anti-semite, homophobe, etc. If we say that those forms of discrimination are morally bad, but, with respect to animals, we are all “on our own journey” and we cannot make moral assessments about, for instance, dairy consumption, then we are simply being speciesist and not applying the same moral analysis to nonhumans that we apply to the human context.
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: If we still advise we shall never do.
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: If we are ever going to see a paradigm shift, we have to be clear about how we want the present paradigm to shift.We must be clear that veganism is the unequivocal baseline of anything that deserves to be called an “animal rights” movement. If “animal rights” means anything, it means that we cannot morally justify any animal exploitation; we cannot justify creating animals as human resources, however “humane” that treatment may be.We must stop thinking that people will find veganism “daunting” and that we have to promote something less than veganism. If we explain the moral ideas and the arguments in favor of veganism clearly, people will understand. They may not all go vegan immediately; in fact, most won’t. But we should always be clear about the moral baseline. If someone wants to do less as an incremental matter, let that be her/his decision, and not something that we advise to do. The baseline should always be clear. We should never be promoting “happy” or “humane” exploitation as morally acceptable.
author: Gary L. Francione

quote: Free thinker walks on shortcuts among wisdoms.
author: save your hearts for the one who wants to hold your hand.

quote: The rights paradigm, which, as I interpret it, morally requires the abolition of animal exploitation and requires veganism as a matter of fundamental justice, is radically different from the welfarist paradigm, which, in theory focuses on reducing suffering, and, in reality, focuses on tidying up animal exploitation at its economically inefficient edges. In science, those who subscribe to one paradigm are often unable to understand and engage those who subscribe to another paradigm precisely because the theoretical language that they use is not compatible.I think that the situation is similar in the context of the debate between animal rights and animal welfare. And that is why welfarists simply cannot understand or accept the slavery analogy.
author: T.S. Eliot

quote: Men grow tired of sleep, love, singing and dancing, sooner than war.
author: Mark Twain, The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

quote: We are exactly where we have chosen to be.
author: Simon Van Booy, Love Begins in Winter: Five Stories

quote: Let us be sure that the lady of our choice possesses certain tangible qualities that we admire; and if in other ways she falls short of our ideal, we must be patient and call to mind those qualities that first induced us to begin our courting.
author: José Saramago, The Cave

quote: Only to the degree that people have what they need, that they are healthy and unafraid, that their lives are varied, interesting, meaningful, productive, joyous, can we begin to judge, or even guess, their nature. Few people, adults or children, now live such lives.
author: Stillness is the movementOf our atmosphere

quote: CAN is the enemy of DO.
author: Hannah B (Who is rebellious for everything)

quote: yet if you had a desire for good or beautiful thingsand your tongue were not concocting some evil to sayshame would not hold down your eyesbut rather you would speak about what is just
author: Edward Abbey, Postcards from Ed: Dispatches and Salvos from an American Iconoclast

quote: We are unknown to ourselves, we men of knowledge - and with good reason. We have never sought ourselves - how could it happen that we should ever find ourselves? It has rightly been said: "Where your treasure is, there will your heart be also"; our treasure is where the beehives of our knowledge are.
author: Daisy Goodwin, The American Heiress

quote: Buddhism is all about science. If science is the systematic pursuit of the accurate knowledge of reality, then science is Buddhism, Buddhism is science.
author: Benjamin Franklin, The Way to Wealth

quote: There are three kind of history. The first is what really happened and that is forever lost. The second is what most people thought happened, and we can recover that with assiduous effort. The third is what the people in power wanted the future to think happened and that is 90 percent of the history in books.
author: C.P. Snow, The Masters

quote: I would rather risk failure than achieve it without risk.
author: Jefferson Smith, Strange Places

quote: To advance spiritually requires a method of practice & determination to carry it out.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: The dead to the grave, the living to the loaf.
author: Georges Clémenceau

quote: Don’t become bigoted about bigots.
author: Danny Wilson

quote: Es decir..., lo que yo creo es que el hombre piensa en el significado de la vida porque sabe con certeza que va morir algún día. (...) Nadie sabe lo que va a ocurrir. Por eso nosotros, para evolucionar necesitamos la muerte.
author: James Welch

quote: One thing, all things: move among and intermingle, without distinction. To live in this realization is to be without anxiety about non-perfection. To live in this faith is the road to non-duality, because the non-dual is one with the trusting mind.
author: Sengcan, Hsin Hsin Ming

quote: One may enter the literary parlor via just about any door, be it the prison door, the madhouse door, or the brothel door. There is but one door one may not enter it through, which is the child room door. The critics will never forgive you such. The great Rudyard Kipling is one of a number of people to have suffered from this. I keep wondering to myself what this peculiar contempt towards anything related to childhood is all about.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

quote: ...a blink of an eye in itself is nothing. But the eye that blinks, that is something.
author: Vera Nazarian, The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration

quote: ‎your first thought would send the power of Quantum physics into a hive of activity. your first thought, would inevitably become the destiny of the day
author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quote: I have more wisdom than any books ever written in history of times, any scripture ever written which you rhyme but this is not my purpose.
author: Sorin Cerin

quote: The absolute truth is one for an infinity of possible relative truths which lie.
author: Patricia Grasso, Courting an Angel

quote: Let the fear of danger be a spur to prevent it; he that fears not, gives advantage to the danger.
author: Kensington Roth

quote: It would be a mistake, though, to consider care by family doctors or midwives inferior to that offered by obstetricians simply on the grounds that obstetricians need not refer care to a family physician or midwife if no complications develop during a course of labor.
author: Gertrude Bell

quote: In seeking wisdom thou art wise
author: Voltaire

quote: Wenn man noch nicht das Leben kennt, wie sollte man den Tod kennen.
author: Confucius, Gespräche

quote: Si quelques heures font une grande différence dans le cœur de l’homme, faut-il s’en étonner ? Il n’y a qu’une minute de la vie à la mort.
author: Sophocles

quote: The confidence essential to effective habit-making comes as a rule from knowledge of previous and related successes.
author: Kim Stanley Robinson, Green Mars

quote: When one feels oneself smitten by love for a woman, one ought to say to oneself, “What are her surroundings? What has been her life? All one’s future happiness lies in the answer.
author: Renae A. Sauter, An Empowered Life: Mind/Body/Spirit Empowerment

quote: SAYING OF SHEIKH ZIAUDIN:Self-justification is worse than the original offence.
author: Krystal Sutherland, Our Chemical Hearts

quote: Haste is from the Devil.
author: DeWayne Owens

quote: There is a knowledge that is beyond the mind and the intellect, it is the wisdom of consciousness.
author: Viet Thanh Nguyen, The Sympathizer

quote: I am no wise man. Every day shows me how little I know about life, and how wrong I can be. But there are things I know to be true. I know I will die. And I know that the only sane response to such a horror is to love.
author: Nando Parrado, Miracle in the Andes

quote: There is no Jesus without Judas, no Martin Luther King, Jr., without the Klan; no Ali without Joe Frazier; no freedom without tyranny. No wisdom exists that does not include perspective. Relativity is the greatest gift.
author: Catherynne M. Valente, The Girl Who Soared Over Fairyland and Cut the Moon in Two

quote: Am I a man of great wisdom? Hardly! Even when a simple person brings me a question, my mind goes utterly blank, I just thrash it out until I’ve exhausted every possibility.
author: Mark Twain, The Man That Corrupted Hadleyburg

quote: It’s less a matter of looking the other way than of closing our eyes to what we can’t stop from happening.
author: Dan Brown, Inferno

quote: Wise men are not pacifists
author: Sandra Chami Kassis

quote: It Hurts...It Kills...It Teaches...It Thrills...“IT” Is LIFE...!
author: Tahir Shah, In Arabian Nights: A Caravan of Moroccan Dreams

quote: There is only one thing which is generally safe from plagiarism -- self-denial.
author: Rob Liano

quote: Knowledge unlocks the door to the mysteries of our mistakes; wisdom guides us away from repeating them". HS/el
author: Sujit Lalwani, Life Simplified!

quote: Travel Moulds A Man,People Mould His Wisdom And Experiences Mould His LIFE...!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: A Guardian is only as strong as its Muse.
author: Alasdair Gray, Poor Things

quote: Art is art. You can take it or leave it. Liking it or not liking it does not make you a better person, and who you like or dislike results in the same thing.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri, Brushstrokes of a Gadfly

quote: Your greatest responsibility is to live a life that nourishes your highest truth.
author: Jodi Picoult, Lone Wolf

quote: Yesterday I was clever,That is why I wanted to change the world.Today I am wise,That is why I am changing myself.
author: Marilynne Robinson

quote: In science, mistakes always precede the truth.
author: Mollie Marti

quote: This, then, is held to be the duty of the man of wealth: To set an example of modest, unostentatious living, shunning display or extravagance; to provide moderately for the legitimate wants of those dependent on him; and, after doing so, to consider all surplus revenues which come to him simply as trust funds, which he is called upon to administer, and strictly bound as a matter of duty to administer in the manner which, in his judgement, is best calculated to produce the most beneficial results for the community--the man of wealth thus becoming the mere trustee and agent for his poorer brethren, bringing to their service his superior wisdom, experience, and ability to administer, doing for them better than they would or could do for themselves.
author: it is our own spiritual awareness and philosophical wisdom that is lagging behind.

quote: Magic is a dangerous thing, child. It isn’t something to use lightly.
author: Kevis Hendrickson

quote: There was a considerable difference between the ages of my parents, but this circumstance seemed to unite them only closer in bonds of devoted affection.
author: Kevis Hendrickson

quote: The waters of spirituality are forever changing and forever constant. Prejudice or fixed ideas can only weigh you down and remove you from the flow. - The Book of Metanoia (D. Williamsen)
author: E.A. Bucchianeri, Brushstrokes of a Gadfly

quote: You never understand life until it grows inside of you.
author: Sandra Chami Kassis

quote: [Y]ou are here to learn something. Don’t try to figure out what it is. This can be frustrating and unproductive.
author: Pablo

quote: It is worth remembering one of the important lessons of the Buck story: a small number of zealous advocates can have an impact on the law that defies both science and conventional wisdom.
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: When the wisdom speaks, be quite and listen! When the stupidity speaks, stand up and leave!
author: Tahir Shah, Travels With Myself

quote: We shall live to die once more.
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: The world is fairly studded and strewn with pennies cast broadside by a generous hand. But- and this is the point- who gets excited by a mere penny? But if you cultivate a healthy poverty and simplicity, so that finding a penny will literally make your day, then, since the world is in fact planted in pennies, you have with your poverty bought a lifetime of days.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

quote: You are as much able as you know
author: Annie Dillard, For the Time Being

quote: …one half of her should not be always so much wiser than the other half…
author: Fulton J. Sheen, Life of Christ

quote: [T]he wisdom of our ancestors is in the simile.
author: Luther E. Vann, Elemental: The Power of Illuminated Love

quote: With infinite wisdom and care your life is constantly sustained because Nature flows through you.
author: Immaculée Ilibagiza, Left to Tell: Discovering God Amidst the Rwandan Holocaust

quote: Really to believe in human nature while striving to know the thousand forces that warp it from its ideal development-to call for and expect much from men and women, and not to be disappointed and embittered if they fall short- to try to do good with people rather than to them- this is my religion on its human side. And if God exists, I think that he must be in the warm sun, in the kindly actions of the people we know and read of, in the beautiful things of art and nature, and in the closeness of friendships.
author: Kent Allan Rees, Molly Withers and the Golden Tree

quote: Take away from love the fullness of self surrender, the completeness of personal commitment, and what remains will be a total denial and negation of it.
author: Hazrat Inayat Khan

quote: Television is for appearing on - not for looking at.
author: J.B.S. Haldane, Possible Worlds

quote: مخافة الرب رأس المعرفةأم 7:1
author: Marguerite Yourcenar, Memoirs of Hadrian

quote: Patience is supported & nurtured by a quality of forgiveness.
author: Allan Lokos, Patience: The Art of Peaceful Living

quote: You can know all there is to know about life and mankind, but what do you really know about yourself?
author: Meseret Geneti

quote: ...you have to be godly to be wise ...
author: Richard Finney, Demon Days: Angel of Light

quote: The Great Way is not difficult for those who have no preferences. When love and hate are both absent everything becomes clear and undisguised. Make the smallest distinction, however, and heaven and earth are set infinitely apart. If you wish to see the truth then hold no opinion for or against. The struggle of what one likes and what one dislikes is the disease of the mind.
author: Sengcan, Hsin Hsin Ming

quote: Cieszy mię ten rym: „Polak mądr po szkodzie”;Lecz jeśli prawda i z tego nas zbodzie,Nową przypowieść Polak sobie kupi,Że i przed szkodą, i po szkodzie głupi.
author: Swami Satchidananda, The Yoga Sutras

quote: A doctor may know more than a peasant, but a peasant and a doctor know more together.
author: Sarah Palin

quote: It is the business of man to become acquainted with the material universe in all of its manifestations, so far as may be possible, in order to provide a foundation of knowledge on which the reasoning mind of man may increasingly build.
author: Sorin Cerin, Wisdom Collection: The Book of Wisdom

quote: One of the disadwantages of school and learning, he thought dreamily, was that the mind seemed to have the tendency too see and represent all things as though they were flat and had only two dimensions. This, somehow, seemed to render all matters of intellect shallow and worthless...
author: Veda Catherine Storey

quote: The meaning of the words is necessary and not their extent.
author: Sorin Cerin

quote: The truth can only be absolute as any relativity may include the untruth towards the system of reference where it varies.
author: Ralph Alfred Habas, The Art of Self-Control

quote: Wisdom’s Pearl doth often dwellClosed in Fancy’s rainbow shell
author: Sorin Cerin

quote: Die Einsicht eines Menschen verleiht ihre Flügel keinem anderen.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: The only way to heal is to help others heal, and the only way to find love and keep love in our lives is to give it to others.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D., The Pursuit of Dreams: Claim Your Power, Follow Your Heart, and Fulfill Your Destiny

quote: Thinking about the future is the worst way of thinking about the future. Working on your future is the best way of thinking about your future.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: The reason why we get the same partners is not because people are the same, but because we pull the dark shadow of past hurts over our eyes and we live the same all over again. We change the actors, but never the masks we give them in our play.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: In moments of great change we suffer, somehow hoping deep down that our emotions and our dramas can change the future or prevent it from happening. Future happens regardless.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: Focus on the win and you lose the battle, focus on the battle and you win.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: A stupid leader is like a dog who’s in love with his own voice. He will bark incessantly believing that people admire his tune. A wise leader gets his point across in as few words as possible and then gets off the stage.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: Wise people offer their wisdom for free and accept all gifts, for they know that the universe is not giving them gifts, but tools they will need on their road to wisdom.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: A leader, without wisdom, is dangerous. A wise person, without leadership, is useless. But if they work together, they are unstoppable.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: There are only three things which increase when shared: love, wisdom and happiness.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: The universe is an ocean upon which we are the waves. While some decide to surf, others venture to dive.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: To preserve your innocence while acquiring intelligence, that is a true mark of wisdom.
author: Charbel Tadros

quote: Our heart calls us one way, the mind pulls us the other way, and we do the opposite. We cannot find peace when the mind rages war against the heart, when we fight with our thoughts the pull of our love.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: For thousands of years humanity has been trying to answer the question: “Do we have life after death?” Maybe for the first time you must now answer the question: “Do I really have a life before death?
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: THE MOST HURTFUL BELIEF: We live in a world where we are taught that we get by taking.
author: Dragos Bratasanu, Ph.D.

quote: without the bombardment of thoughts, the truth will emerge through intuition.
author: Melody  Lee, Moon Gypsy

quote: Life is a travel through time.
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, Book of Wisdom

quote: Because I started investing in wiserrelationships, I am now an absurdly wealthy woman—if blessings,fulfillment & joy are measured as wealth.
author: Amber Hurdle, The Bombshell Business Woman: How to Become a Bold, Brave, and Successful Female Entrepreneur

quote: Wisdom is knowing when you have enough.
author: Alfa H, Abandoned Breaths

quote: We rely on our education, on our judgment and our intuition to make decisions, but sometimes we find ourselves in the most dangerous scenario we can be in as individuals or as team, when we don’t know that we don’t know but we believe we do know.
author: Mircea Popister

quote: When we are young we squander time as though it were unlimited; When we grow older, then like beggars we wish for crumbs of remembrance...
author: Annabel Lyon, The Sweet Girl

quote: You do not deserve what you think you deserve, But you Deserve what you do.
author: Wu Wei, I Ching Wisdom: More Guidance from the Book of Answers

quote: It is unwise to be part of what reduces you to less than yourself
author: Wu Wei, I Ching Wisdom: More Guidance from the Book of Answers

quote: We make the money
author: Anonymous

quote: I also saw under the sun this example of wisdom that greatly impressed me: There was once a small city with only a few people in it. And a powerful king came against it, surrounded it and built huge siege works against it. Now there lived in that city a man poor but wise, and he saved the city by his wisdom. But nobody remembered that poor man.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: To enter the land of wisdom, firstly start changing the angles you look at the things!
author: Native Teachings

quote: Fear was wisdom in a situation like this, and he was pleased that Folly was obviously intelligent enough to know it. He hoped that she would use the fear to make her cleverer, rather than more foolish, but that was asking much of a human, relatively odd or not.
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: Intelligence is seeing the ups, downs, cycles and patterns in the game of life. Wisdom is not being played or a player - but being at one with life, dancing with life, being full of life, in flow with life - glad to be alive.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: What you see is highly dependent on how you look.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: At critical moments in the life of individuals and of societies, it is not necessarily the facts that are needed as much as a profound narrative that makes sense of life’s conflicts and misunderstandings. When all seems to be falling apart and becoming less rational and more chaotic, it is usually a different story that is needed to make things whole again. Mythic imagination can break the spell of time and open us to a level of life that remains timeless. Myth is not about what happened in past times; myth is about what happens to people all of the time.
author: Jennifer White - Strong Heart Awakening

quote: You are always afraid that somebody may think you a fool. You are afraid that if others think you to be a fool, you will start suspecting it. If so many people think you a fool your self-confidence will be lost. And if everybody goes on repeating that you are a fool, sooner or later you will come to believe it.Only a wise man cannot be deceived, he can appear as a fool.Have you observed yourself?
