quote: When you look up and don’t see the stars, the universe may have cleared the sky for you to replace them.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: Don’t let mediocre people talk you out of your dreams
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: Living honestly is a prerequisite for a clear conscience.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: Live your best and leave the rest
author: Chinonye J. Chidolue

quote: Be like seeds; do not see dirt thrown at you as your enemy, but as ground to grow.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: You trails are part of your life because the trails are the reasons to receive the life.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo

quote: To be knowledgeable, sit before scholars; to be wise, sit before life.
author: Ikechukwu Izuakor, Great Reflections on Success

quote: Yesterday, I was clever, I wanted to be rich. Today, I am wise, I want to be happy.
author: Olivia Sinaga

quote: He is not an ideal husband. I am his wife.
author: the pen has been in their hands. I will not allow books to prove anything.

quote: I think all women should be able to make it on their own,” Frankie said. “It’s not about needing a manor not — it just means she knows she can do whatever she sets out to do.
author: Emmeline Pankhurst, My Own Story

quote: Greatness is achieved through kindness, compassion, and love.
author: Anthony Powell, A Dance to the Music of Time: 2nd Movement

quote: Women do not admit to the past, they mourn for past even less. They grab from each moment anything they can reach.
author: Mary Tornyenyor

quote: Women instinctually know how to nourish each other, and just being with each other is restorative
author: bell hooks, All About Love: New Visions

quote: Peace is when we look upon the world together.
author: Mark  Manson

quote: My tongue thirsty for superiority, maybe even immortality, ruled me. I was ruled by my tongue. I was ruled by women. I was ruled by alcohol.
author: Shirin Ebadi, Iran Awakening

quote: To be a jazz freedom fighter is to attempt to galvanize and energize world-weary people into forms of organization with accountable leadership that promote critical exchange and broad reflection. The interplay of individuality and unity is not one of uniformity and unanimity imposed from above but rather of conflict among diverse groupings that reach a dynamic consensus subject to questioning and criticism. As with a soloist in a jazz quartet, quintet or band, individuality is promoted in order to sustain and increase the creative tension with the group--a tension that yields higher levels of performance to achieve the aim of the collective project.
author: Maureen Johnson, The Last Little Blue Envelope

quote: She wasn’t going to sit and wait. She was done waiting, because you could spend your whole life waiting for something to happen. Something big. You could wait and wait, and even if something big happened, even if it finally happened—it didn’t change anything.
author: Crystal Kadakia, The Millennial Myth: Transforming Misunderstanding Into Workplace Breakthroughs

quote: Take a close look at nature and you’ll see that every living creature is wired for mutation and variation. The fact that people can say, “I’m not the same person I used to be,” is the greatest of all miracles.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Spiritual regeneration is a change on the inside of a person or nation as a a result of coming to Jesus, and a change of value system in his life
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Humans are funny. The more someone doesn’t want someone, the more that someone wants that someone. The time came when she started pulling away. She had developed a tendency to focus on the things that she didn’t respect in him and eventually that’s all she saw.
author: Ross  Turner, Midnight

quote: If you truly love who you are, travel through this life with conviction, spread joy to others, embrace changes as they happen, then you will find balance in your life.
author: Sandesh limbu

quote: We ,human beings, are strong because we are capable of change
author: Chanda Kaushik

quote: We can only teach what we have learned.
author: Deyth Banger, The Life of One Kid 1

quote: I am an engineer and hoping not just to change the world but also to touch human hearts.
author: Richard Paul Evans, Lost December

quote: The truth can be known or realized but cannot be change or modify.
author: Khali Raymond

quote: Selecting the right measure and measuring things right are both art and science. And KPIs influence management behavior as well as business culture.
author: Pearl Zhu, Change Insight: Change as an Ongoing Capability to Fuel Digital Transformation

quote: Your good character and attitude should be your message to the world.
author: Tommy Wallach, Thanks for the Trouble

quote: The only bearable thing about being human is that you can change, the second you feel like. Get it through your head that you changes, and cut yourself some slack before you fucking choke to death from all the apologies in your throat.
author: Ann Brashares, The Second Summer of the Sisterhood

quote: The Joy of one SUCCESS can overcome the Heartaches of twenty Failures.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: In life we can never really value peace unless we experience war.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: Glory in your small dreams, because inside them something bigger may emerge.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: Nothing guarantees a person effortless wealth as when his SEASON comes.
author: Kcat Yarza, KCAT CAN: I have a pen that writes

quote: The world will become only as great a place to live in as we make it. And, for that, the world needs us. It needs us to get invested. It needs us to be more grateful. It needs us to take things personally! And, I know together we can make it happen. I know wherever you’ll go; you’ll stand for change, for peace, for justice, for equality, for each other, and for a better tomorrow. You’ll put in your brick. I know. I know.
author: Moira Wegel

quote: I think adults must get sort of worn away over time, like rocks out at sea, but remain who they are, just slower and grayer with those funny vertical wrinkles in front of their ears. But the young are a different shape from one week to the next. To know us is to run alongside us, like someone trying to shout through the window of a moving train.
author: Kamand Kojouri

quote: Reinvention is my philosophy, if you want to call it that,” he says, looking out the window. “Imagination is the key to creating a life that is ever new.” Stanley turns his eyes to me. “We are each of us a changeling person,” he says. “We are not going to be the same decade after decade. Wisdom results from confronting not only one’s desires and capacities but also one’s limitations.” “The Layers,” one of Stanley’s best-loved poems, is his crystallization of this wisdom. I have walked through many lives, some of them my own, and I am not who I was, though some principle of being abides from which I struggle not to stray. When I look behind, as I am compelled to look before I can gather strength to proceed on my journey, I see the milestones dwindling toward the horizon and the slow fires trailing from the abandoned camp-sites, over which scavenger angels wheel on heavy wings. Oh, I have made myself a tribe out of my true affections, and my tribe is scattered! How shall the heart be reconciled to its feast of losses? In a rising wind the manic dust of my friends, those who fell along the way, bitterly stings my face. Yet I turn, I turn, exulting somewhat, with my will intact to go wherever I need to go, and every stone on the road is precious to me. In my darkest night, when the moon was covered and I roamed through wreckage, a nimbus-clouded voice directed me: “Live in the layers, not on the litter.” Though I lack the art to decipher it, no doubt the next chapter in my book of transformations is already written. I am not done with my changes.
author: Gary Rohrmayer

quote: Change isn’t closing the door on the old, it is opening the door on the new.
author: Fritjof Capra

quote: Reality can be mischievous at times, fragile, fleeting; with the potential to change vastly without warning.
author: Rebecca McNutt, Super 8: The Sequel to Smog City

quote: You have to accept the situation to be able to change it.
author: Deyth Banger

quote: Life roars at us when it wants or needs us to change. Ultimately, change means trans formation, a shifting from one form to another that involves the magic of creation. The trouble with entrenched oppositions is that each side becomes increasingly one-sided and single minded and unable to grow or meaningfully change. In the blindness of fear and the willfulness of abstract beliefs, people forget or reject the unseen yet essential unity that underlies all the oppositions in life.
author: P. Wish

quote: The ego is our pain, but it is what we know and we resist moving out of it.  The effort it takes to grow out of painful patterns often feels more uncomfortable than remaining within them.  Personal growth can be so painful because it can make us ashamed and humiliated to face our own darkness.   But the goal of personal growth is the journey out of dark emotional patterns which cause us pain to those which cause us peace.
author: Kristin Granger

quote: I must change my life so that I can live it, not wait for it.
author: Steven Redhead, Unleash The Power of Your Heart and Mind

quote: In a condition of struggle and of failure we must be able to say "I must try harder" or "I must try differently." Both views are essential . . . A change in either makes for a change in outcome. When we say "I must try harder" we mean that the most relevant variable is something within us - intention, will, determination, "meaning it" . . When we say "I must try differently" we mean that the most relevant variable lies in the situation within which intention is being exerted, that we should look to the environment, to the ways it pushes and pulls at us, and in this study find the means to alter that interaction.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Time stood still so she learnt to alter her focus.
author: J.R. Rim

quote: Whenever, you face a challenge, it is time for a change.
author: Sam Weiss

quote: Beauty will not come at the call of the legislature.... It will come, as always, unannounced, and spring up between the feet of brave and earnest men.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Beautiful and Damned

quote: I preferred my brand of beauty where Norah was more beautiful than any bimbette, and Mom was beautiful whether sized extra-small or extra-large. Where Peony could look at herself in the mirror and murmur, wow, look at me. Just look at me.
author: Jenn Fagan

quote: In a world full of war, famine, oppression, deceit, monotony, what—apart from the eternal innocence of animals—offers an image of hope? A mother with a newborn child in her arms? The child may end up as a murderer or a murder victim, so that the hopeful image is a prefiguration of a pietà: a mother with her newly dead child on her lap.
author: E.M. Forster

quote: Some days after, the girl encountered her again, in a dream, as she was years ago: a very slender young woman in a long white skirt, her amber hair to her waist, her eyes coal black with ardor.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche, Daybreak: Thoughts on the Prejudices of Morality

quote: ...The sublime feeling is not mere pleasure as taste is – it is a mixture of pleasure and pain... Confronted with objects that are too big according to their magnitude or tooviolent according to their power, the mind experiences its own limitations.
author: Tatsuhiko Takimoto, Welcome to the N.H.K.

quote: If I had any hand in it at all there’s a chance that it might be beautiful, but it simply cannot not be majestic.
author: Joe Jenninigs

quote: There is strength in kindness.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, The Brothers Karamazov

quote: Change is inevitable. Progression is a choice. We all move, but are you going to move forward?
author: Ana Claudia Antunes, A-Z of Happiness: Tips for Living and Breaking Through the Chain that Separates You from Getting That Dream Job

quote: The most beautiful things often stand alone.
author: Rachel Carson, The Sense of Wonder

quote: She shone like the horizon when it is almost too bright to look upon.
author: Scott Lynch, Rogues

quote: The world is corrupt, and the way for me to make it better is not by writing letters, but joining my efforts with those of others to produce a work of beauty.
author: Chloe Thurlow, The Secret Life of Girls

quote: Let your heart shine even more than your face. The beautiful contents of your heart can never be forgotten, but your face will be a history.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: To manifest the beauty of life, think beauty, dream beauty, and see the beauty in the simple things all around you.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: No living thing is ugly in this world. Even a tarantula considers itself beautiful
author: Luffina Lourduraj

quote: Be charming at any age.
author: Robin Benway, Emmy & Oliver

quote: Are we to look at cherry blossoms only in full bloom, the moon only when it is cloudless? To long for the moon while looking on the rain, to lower the blinds and be unaware of the passing of the spring - these are even more deeply moving. Branches about to blossom or gardens strewn with flowers are worthier of our admiration.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: The beauty in the heart is the beauty of body, soul and spirit.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: More than nakedness,for there is no cover to take.The fire in your eyesis ringed with water; wide and cool.We are far from the brutal place,but you do not think so.You take my hand and disappear like you were never there, except that I am now somewhere else.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: A flower blooms to reveal her beauty just to express her gratitude for all the life, love, and light.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Thus the little mermaid learned her world’s greatest paradox: that their currency was beauty, and their coin was body parts.
author: Esther Dalseno, Drown

quote: I romanticized him until he was the perfect being. A soul so beautiful, but so immensely evil too.
author: Miya Yamanouchi, Embrace Your Sexual Self: A Practical Guide for Women

quote: Beautiful moments in life need no words for description. Living those moments and feeling the beauty suffices.
author: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Enjoy the beauty, love and peace of a sacred Christmas.
author: Debasish Mridha M.D.

quote: I like your Christ, I do not like your Christians. Your Christians are so unlike your Christ.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: A theology that cannot be sung is not worth having.... Authentic Christian faith is not merely believed. Nor is it merely acted upon. It is sung - with utter joy sometimes, in uncontrollable tears sometimes, but it is sung.
author: Sallie McFague

quote: Our prayers are something akin to delivering a list, verses surrendering a life. The former will always leave me creating the next list, while the latter will leave me creating a new life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: From a medical standpoint, the third and the most probable explanation is that Jesus was indeed dead, and what his disciples experienced were mere hallucinations evoked by the grief over the loss of their beloved teacher. It is clinically known as “Post-Bereavement Hallucinations Experiences” or PBHE.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: Forget the face of God, and forget your own name is Beloved.
author: George MacDonald, Mary Marston

quote: Easter is a time when God turned the inevitability of death into the invincibility of life.
author: C.S. Lewis, Mere Christianity

quote: The Koran is empathetic about the rights of other religions to practice their own beliefs. It unequivocally condemns attacks on civilians as a violation of Islam. It states that suicide, of any type, is an abomination. The tactic of suicide bombing, equated by many of the new atheists with Islam, did not arise from the Muslim world. This kind of terror, in fact, has its roots in radical Western ideologies, especially Leninism, not religion. And it was the Tamil Tigers, a Marxist group that draws its support from the Hindu families of the Tamil regions of Sri Lanka, which invented the suicide vest for their May 1991 suicide assassination of Rajiv Gandhi.Suicide bombing is what you do when you do not have artillery or planes or missiles and you want to create maximum terror for an occupying power. It was used by secular anarchists in the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. They bequeathed to us the first version of the car bomb: a horse-drawn wagon laden with explosives that was ignited on September 16, 1920, on Wall Street. The attack was carried out by Mario Buda, an Italian immigrant, in protest over the arrest of the anarchists Sacco and Vanzetti. It left 40 people dead and wounded more than 200.Suicide bombing was adopted later by Hezbollah, al-Qaeda and Hamas. But even in the Middle East, suicide bombing is not restricted to Muslims. In Lebanon during the suicide attacks in the 1980s against French, American and Israeli targets, only eight suicide bombings were carried out by Islamic fundamentalists. Twenty-seven were the work of communists and socialists. Three were carried out by Christians.
author: Sue Detweiler, Women Who Move Mountains: Praying with Confidence, Boldness, and Grace

quote: The first nation to separate Christianity from government produced perhaps the most religious nation on earth.
author: Nadia Bolz-Weber, Pastrix: The Cranky, Beautiful Faith of a Sinner & Saint

quote: There has been more bloodshed in the name of God than for any other cause. And it is all because people never attempt to reach the fountain-head. They are content only to comply with the customs of their forefathers and instructions on some books, and want others to do the same. But, to explain God after merely reading the scriptures is like explaining the city of New York after seeing it only in a map.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Love, God & Neurons: Memoir of a scientist who found himself by getting lost

quote: [T]he present age, which prefers the sign to the thing signified, the copy to the original[.]
author: Os Hillman, Today God Is First: 365 Meditations on Christ Kingdom Principles in the Workplace

quote: Stop trying, & start trusting.
author: Caryll Houselander, The Reed of God

quote: Authority, reason, experience; on these three, mixed in varying proportions all our knowledge depends.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: If the Anabaptists teach us anything, it is that those who fear freedom and court the governments of this world in the interest of a more moral or "Christian" state are placing their faith in a broken reed. For the Anabaptists, there is only one way, the way of the cross, for the church to become "salt, light, and leaven" in any society and in every age.
author: Oswald Chambers

quote: The worst thing that I can do is humanize God. The second worst thing that I can do is deify myself. And the best thing that I can do is to avoid both.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: But should not atheists have an equal obligation to explain the origin of pleasure in a world of randomness and meaninglessness?
author: Michael Vito Tosto, Portrait of an Infidel: The Acerbic Account of How a Passionate Christian Became an Ardent Atheist

quote: Preach Christ ! Preach the gospelPreach Christ
author: Tony Hendra, Father Joe: The Man Who Saved My Soul

quote: We are a pluralist civilisation because we allow mosques to be built in our countries, and we are not going to stop simply because Christian missionaries are thrown into prison in Kabul. If we did so, we, too, would become Taliban.
author: Octavia E. Butler, Bloodchild and Other Stories

quote: What is it to be a follower of Jesus? What does it mean to imitate Him? What does it mean to walk in His steps?
author: Charles M. Sheldon, In His Steps

quote: ... The dominion of good men is profitable, not so much for themselves as for human affairs. But the dominion of bad men is hurtful chiefly to themselves who rule, for they destroy their own souls by greater licence in wickedness;
author: Christian Hunt, The Dawn of Grace

quote: There is a difference between a church that prays and a praying church. One has prayer programs. The other develops a prayer culture.
author: Daniel Henderson, Old Paths, New Power: Awakening Your Church Through Prayer and the Ministry of the Word

quote: We ought to know the Creator.
author: Anonymous

quote: Lord of lords!
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Christ is to the souls of men what the sun is to the world. He is the center and source of all spiritual light, warmth, life, health, growth, beauty, and fertility. Like the sun, He shines for the common benefit of all mankind--for high and for low, for rich and for poor, for Jew and for Greek. Like the sun, He is free to all. All may look at Him, and drink health out of His light. If millions of mankind were mad enough to dwell in caves underground, or to bandage their eyes, their darkness would be their own fault, and not the fault of the sun. So, likewise, if millions of men and women love spiritual "darkness rather than light," the blame must be laid on their blind hearts, and not on Christ. "Their foolish hearts are darkened." (John 3:19; Romans 1:21.) But whether men will see or not, Christ is the true sun, and the light of the world. There is no light for sinners except in the Lord Jesus.
author: Henry Cloud

quote: Until the evil man finds evil unmistakably present in his existence, in the form of pain, he is enclosed in illusion.
author: René Girard, I See Satan Fall Like Lightning

quote: I know Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: From a theological point of view, Easter is the center of the Church year; but Christmas is the most profoundly human feast of faith, because it allows us to feel most deeply the humanity of God. The crib has a unique power to show us what it means to say that God wished to be “Immanuel”—a “God with us”, a God whom we may address in intimate language, because he encounters us as a child.
author: Richard Hofstadter, Anti-Intellectualism in American Life

quote: We face many trials, beyond our human ability to endure. We learn to depend on only God’s grace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Productivity—true productivity—will never be better or stronger than the foundation you build it upon.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: It is true that the modern Christian is less robust, but that is not thanks to Christianity; it is thanks to the generations of freethinkers, who from the Renaissance to the present day, have made Christians ashamed of many of their traditional beliefs. It is amusing to hear the modern Christian telling you how mild and rationalistic Christianity really is and ignoring the fact that all its mildness and rationalism is due to the teaching of men who in their own day were persecuted by all orthodox Christians.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: The bond of love will unite the world.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: God loves you and created you in His own image.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Christmas is a sacred festival. It is celebration of Christ love for Humankind. And the love that bind us together.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: We ought to love one another at Christmas and every day of the year.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: I wish you a blessed beautiful Christmas with the fullness of grace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: My idea of Christmas is love. Love so pure and so divine.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: God’s great love is the grace of redemption.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: We don’t survive to live. We live to survive.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: May my thanksgiving be my prayer.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: We will bear much fruits, when we connect to the true vine, the Creator.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Gratitude is heavenly bliss.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: You can endure all things by grace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Every new morning brings new mercy, new love and new grace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: You can never out-give God.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: If God has really done something in Christ on which the salvation of the world depends, and if He has made it known, then it is a Christian duty to be intolerant of everything which ignores, denies, or explains it away.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The state of no being knows neither pleasure nor pain.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Faith is a firm assurance.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: If we focus on the problems of life, we will be paralysed. But we dwell on the promise of God; we find the faith, hope and courage to survive life.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Walking in the path of light is heavenly paradise.
author: Reverend Ada Slaton Bonds

quote: I am positive that much that passes for the gospel in our day is very little more than a very mild case of orthodox religion grafted on to a heart that is sold out to the world in its pleasures and tastes and ambitions.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The Lord cared for us in the wilderness. May we never forget Him in times of abundance.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Gratefulness is the glory to God.
author: David Livingstone

quote: I cannot, of course, prove that there is no supervising deity who invigilates my every momentand who will pursue me even after I am dead. (I can only be happy that there is no evidence forsuch a ghastly idea, which would resemble a celestial North Korea in which liberty was not justimpossible but inconceivable.) But nor has any theologian ever demonstrated the contrary. Thiswould perhaps make the believer and the doubter equal—except that the believer claims to know,not just that God exists, but that his most detailed wishes are not merely knowable but actuallyknown. Since religion drew its first breath when the species lived in utter ignorance andconsiderable fear, I hope I may be forgiven for declining to believe that another human being cantell me what to do, in the most intimate details of my life and mind, and to further dictate theseterms as if acting as proxy for a supernatural entity. This tyrannical idea is very much older than P a g e | 5 of 29Christianity, of course, but I do sometimes think that Christians have less excuse for believing, letalone wishing, that such a horrible thing could be true.
author: Darnell Lamont Walker

quote: The Lord God is my hope, my joy and my strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The Mighty King is the God of all grace.
author: Mikhail Khorev

quote: We must live as people with great hope.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Great joy comes from God.
author: Bernard Cornwell, The Burning Land

quote: Great God, Great faith.Great faith, Great spirit.Great spirit, Great soul.Great soul, great life.Great life, great deeds.Great deeds, great blessings.
author: Criss Jami, Healology

quote: We write to strengthen our soul and the spirit of other souls.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The divinity within is an endless strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The grace of joyful living gives strength to the bones.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The proponents of Marxian biology appear in unexpected places. In the early disputes over evolution, the most effective aid to the Marxian line came from the humanitarian but conservative Christians, who not only rejected evolution on theological grounds, but who also looked with horror on the amoral viciousness of what they took to be natural selection. Marx himself had also objected to the competitive aspects of natural selection, so both his followers and the more conservative religious groups found themselves on the same side. In fact, the Marxian biologists of the last seventy-five years had their pathways made smooth by the Victorian fundamentalists.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The Lord God must be greatly feared!
author: Sarah Jakes

quote: We ought to pray persistently.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Imagination is glow of thoughts by supernatural force.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Eternity, sacred time.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Who can understand the profound mystery of God?
author: Latorria Freeman, Turn My Life Around Discovering Your Purpose

quote: Let thy possession be the prosperity of the soul.
author: Abhijit Naskar, I Am The Thread: My Mission

quote: And the young Fisherman said to himself: "How strange a thing this is! The Priest telleth me that the Soul is worth all the gold in the world, and the merchants say that it is not worth a clipped piece of silver.
author: Athanasius of Alexandria, The Life of St. Anthony

quote: A true pilgrimage requires letting go of the very things most people try to hold onto. In seeking after what the soul desires, we become pilgrims with no home but the path the soul would have us follow.
author: Alex Z. Moores, Living in Water

quote: The body impress, yet the soul express". Inner beauty has no expiry date, embrace it.
author: Akshay Vasu

quote: Laughter lightens my heart and therefore heals my soul as well.
author: Akshay Vasu

quote: To love means to embrace and at the same time to withstand many endings, and many many beginnings—all in the same relationship.
author: Kamand Kojouri

quote: Something deep in human make up needs and longs for a taste of eternity--a momentary release from the relentless pace of time.
author: Tamara Stamenkovic

quote: And it is because we all of us know of this sombre power and its perilous manifestations, that we stand in so deep a dread of silence. We can bear, when need must be, the silence of ourselves, that of isolation: but the silence of many - silence multiplied - and above all the silence of a crowd - these are supernatural burdens, whose inexplicable weight brings dread to the mightiest soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Your two selves: Most people are not aware of the fact that they have two different selves. You have a mind and a spirit (consciousness), and though they seem like one thing, they are separate. The way to realize that this is true is to realize that something has to be listening to the thoughts created by your mind.What is it that hears your thoughts?There is the part of you that thinks and the part that hears the thoughts. The thinking part is your mind; the part that hears the thoughts is your spiritual-self. You do not actually hear thoughts through your ears, because your mind is already inside your head. The point is, your spiritual-self receives the things the mind creates in a similar way to hearing them.Check it out: Just ask yourself, what is it that is hearing the thoughts you are thinking right now?It is your spiritual-self, the same thing that receives all life.
author: Avijeet Das

quote: Life is there to attain Liberation while going through the experience of it. It should not be ‘above normal’ or ‘below normal,’ it should be ‘normal’.
author: Kaoru Akagawa

quote: But the body is deeper than the soul and its secrets inscrutable.
author: Herman Melville, Moby-Dick or, The Whale

quote: There’s an infant part in our souls which longs for the lullaby truths of life every night for a tranquil slumber.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: Hardship is the hardest moment to soften the soul.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: Every soul is a soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Seek the truth.
author: Catherine Carrigan, Unlimited Intuition NOW

quote: If I began to drawmyself away from youwe’d still be liketwo mixed colors of paintimpossible to separate.
author: Sanober  Khan, A Thousand Flamingos

quote: In suffering, the soul is stretch to find its full strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Search deeply in your soul, you will find love, peace and joy.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Love is a spiritual soul.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: A sacred soul is a spiritual being.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Attachment-abhorrence is an ‘effect’ and ignorance (of the self) is the ‘cause’!
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: The soul who does not live to give the best, deny the sacred self of full strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The spirit and soul are the body and brain, which are destructible-that is precisely why they are so precious.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: And like the sun, I will always rise.
author: Alfred Tennyson, The Complete Works of Alfred Tennyson

quote: Be still in peace and reach your highest peak.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: Film gives us a second chance at a first impression.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Nature is always talking to you, smiling to you, and singing to you. To understand, you just have to be open to listen with your heart and soul.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: What God says I am is what I am: great soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Your soul may be trampled in times of troubles. But if your spirit is strong, you will survive.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The soul is sustained by spirituality.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The search for the soul is sacred adventure.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Music communicates with the soul.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: Look within, find strength for thy soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Music lifts the soul to spiritual realms.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Determined soul, willing spirit.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The objection to conforming to usages that have become dead to you is that it scatters your force. It loses your time and blurs the impression of your character.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Awaken soul, revive spirit.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: How can you find your soul, if you please every soul?
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Discover your soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The greatest adventure is soul seeking.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: People live for two reasons. There are those who live for the Soul; such people are very rare. All others live for money. All day is spent for money, money, money!
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The Knower of the Soul is considered Self Realized (The Enlightened one). The knower of all the eternal elements is known as Omniscient (sarvagna).
author: A.D. Posey

quote: What, then, is the soul but a prisoner of your flesh? An undying yet constrained energy, bound and enslaved within a shuffling, steadily rotting suit of tissue and savage needs?
author: Khang Kijarro Nguyen

quote: My soul.My spirit.My strength.
author: Lailah   Gifty Akita

quote: I am made of words. Cut me & I bleed sentences. Read me, & I speak to your soul.
author: Virginia Alison

quote: The light in my soul is inextinguishable.
author: Mamur Mustapha

quote: Every sacred soul has in a sacred body.
author: Dinakar Phillip

quote: Fear is the impotence of the soul.
author: Micheline Jean Louis

quote: Souls aren’t discrete units — or even units at all. They’re more like reflections of consciousness in a fractured mirror.
author: Mordecai Richler, Solomon Gursky Was Here

quote: The Heart of what you are is not your body or your thoughts but pure Consciousness itself.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: We Are All One. When we allow ourselves to become aware of this statement in its purest form, we open the doors to reveal the oneness of being. Using the process of conscious evolution we begin to recognize our true underlying identity, for once we have glimpsed the existence of this realm, we then begin to reveal what it is . . . . our true natural state.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Try to keep your soul always in peace and quiet, always ready for whatever our lord may wish to work in you. it is certainly a higher virtue of the soul, and a greater grace, to be able to enjoy the Lord in different times and different places than in only one.
author: Hermes Trismegistus

quote: ...Since in the centre of the soul there is a mansion reserved for God Himself...
author: Duncan McNaughton, Tiny Windows

quote: Awaken my soul.
author: Jean Paul Friedrich Richter

quote: At birth and at dawn for each and every dayit triumphs over the eclipse.It is the very first thing that you see.Its power is blinding at first, anon it opens our eyes to the allure of the world.Each moment it breathes life into us,warms our souls and colors our skin.At gloaming it seems to wane,while it privily awaits a timeto give birth to a new circle of life.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The wiser I become, the less I think beauty has anything to do with appearance.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, Big Magic: Creative Living Beyond Fear

quote: Music gives strength to the spirit.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: If he believed in souls he would have said she had a good one.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Patience is hard when your very soul cries for freedom.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: We must look deep into our soul daily.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: God has the key to open the heart of every soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Love of the soul is happiness to the spirit.
author: Quetzal

quote: We cry to awake the spirituality of the soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The spirit cannot exist in a sealed void. It will eventually devour itself or waste away.
author: Steven Chopade

quote: Too often there is this sinister greed that pulls at my coattails, subtly whispering in the ear of my soul that it is within my rights to tuck away a few dark trinkets to toy with when the tedium of righteous living gets a bit boring. But God would suggest that I empty my pockets.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Love with your soul. Hear your soul speaking, it will always be your guiding light.
author: Ashish Dalela, Uncommon Wisdom: Fault Lines in the Foundations of Atheism

quote: Christianity is a way of life - not a dogma!
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: I did not choose to be a monster—a shell of a man—half-human, half-fiend. I am a tiefling. I am what I am.
author: Munia Khan

quote: Happy mind, happy soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Jagged needle, wicked liesFrom under the skin, pluck evil eyes.Destiny change from pain and coldNow that you pay in blood and soul.
author: Sanober  Khan, A touch, a tear, a tempest

quote: She is trying to control me with fear, because she cannot control me any other way.My eyes open wide. They burn as if they are on fire—no, as if they are made of fire. Eyes are the window to the soul.
author: Zechariah Barrett

quote: Humanity is completely consumed with the pleasures of the flesh
author: it nourishes our soul to bloom flowers of happiness.

quote: When I connect with the animals around me, I connect with their soul. I believe where there is a soul, there is a journey and a purpose.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Spirituality is conversation with God, everything else is just religious custom.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: My experience of chaotic lessons has humbled me enough to know, I could have it worse than I do I now and positive enough to know I can be where I want to be, someday.
author: Beth Revis

quote: Emojin stopped, turned, and nailed him with her glare. “Because she’s making this one piece all she’ll ever need to show the world who she is instead of coloring her body with random images and needing thirty expressions to show her soul.
author: Zavia Hope Thomas

quote: Act on your instinct. It is the spirit of your divinity.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: My soul is filled with exceedingly joy.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

quote: Arise my friend, Awake my friend and work for humanity, not to make it sophisticated, but to make it peaceful first.
author: Alyssa Mastromonaco, Who Thought This Was a Good Idea?: And Other Questions You Should Have Answers to When You Work in the White House

quote: Never let your tiny age misguide you to think the time is not yet up. Get up and do it at any age.
author: Tony Dovale

quote: O my mighty sisters and brothers, forget not that the ideal of humanity is the search of truth. In this pursuit, countless souls have sacrificed themselves in the past. And in this pursuit, countless more shall need to sacrifice themselves.
author: Abhijit Naskar, We Are All Black: A Treatise on Racism

quote: Mark you, no Krishna can clear your eyes and make you look with a broader vision upon life in your march upward and onward, until the Self within you morphs into Krishna – until the Self morphs into Buddha – until the Self turns into Christ.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Rowdy Buddha: The First Sapiens

quote: empty out the toxins of life to avoid clogging
author: Charles S. Stamper, DAILY VICTORY: 40 Day Devotional Inspired by the United States Armed Forces

quote: The two fundamental skills of any leader are creativity and initiative. Creativity to find solutions and initiative to take action on them.
author: Unknown

quote: Help does not come from anywhere outside - it comes only from within ourselves.
author: K. Melissa Kennedy

quote: You send a message by what you say and what you do. If words aren’t supported with consistent actions, they will ring hollow.
author: Lazarus Takawira

quote: Marketing without sales is dead.
author: Kevin Cashman, The Pause Principle: Step Back to Lead Forward

quote: When you accept a leadership role, you take on extra responsibility for your actions toward others. If you shun someone, the effect will trickle down through those who value your opinion.
author: David Kelley

quote: In a world full of lions and tigers entertaining the masses, have you ever seen a wolf performing in a circus?
author: Ashish Patela

quote: People will buy from you consistently for two reasons – because you have cultivated a relationship and because you have gotten them results.
author: Audrey Moralez

quote: Fundamentally, leadership is more about the future, but starts at today.
author: Nigel Cumberland, 100 Things Successful People Do: Little Exercises for Successful Living

quote: True empathy is not about waiting to understand another person; it is about proactively seeking to do so. It takes effort to give another person your full time and attention; to ask others how they are feeling and if they coping well with things. And don’t overlook those closest to you. Never take anyone for granted. Avoid being too preoccupied to sit down and talk with your children, partners and colleagues.
author: Dr. Wanda Bonet-Gascot

quote: To liberate yourself from your own self-judgment is to liberate others from it as well. To love yourself is an act of love for the world.
author: Constance Friday

quote: There is a thin line of difference in being courageous and foolish!
author: Mark Sanborn

quote: Behind every successful innovation, was a presentation in a closed room
author: Ravi Kant

quote: Channeled correctly and integrated properly, our diversity can be our greatest strength.
author: Katherine J. Walden, Seasons: Reflections on Changes Throughout Life

quote: Our real problem is not the pervasiveness of the darkness but a failure of the light. Light always dispels darkness. The glorious light of the resurrection life of Jesus Christ is still sufficient and available to those who reject self-reliance and return to His plan for biblical leadership. This return can reignite the radiance of the Gospel in transforming power.
author: Simon Sinek, Start with Why: How Great Leaders Inspire Everyone to Take Action

quote: John F. Kennedy responded, as he often did when at his best, skillfully mixing dollops of wit with, self-deprecation, and the principle of not-really-going-near-the-question.
author: Mark Kurlansky, 1968: The Year That Rocked the World

quote: Great leadership makes ordinary people into extraordinary people.
author: Larry McMurtry, Lonesome Dove

quote: The world has enough deceit, decay, and despair; be different.
author: Harold Holzer, Lincoln and the Power of the Press: The War for Public Opinion

quote: Duty was not untinged by ambition.
author: Barbara W. Tuchman, The Proud Tower: A Portrait of the World Before the War, 1890-1914

quote: Integrity is the ultimate foundation of leadership.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

quote: The greatest part of our existence enfold in service of humanity.
author: Andrew Zolli, Resilience: Why Things Bounce Back

quote: He disliked the social obligations of the captaincy.
author: Geraldine Brooks, The Secret Chord

quote: The best leaders have the ability to align people to their vision and motivate them to work passionately towards its fulfillment as if it were their own.
author: Peter Northouse

quote: It is much easier to evaluate perfect rather than partial results.
author: T.K. Naliaka

quote: Young, healthy communities can afford to roll the dice.
author: leadership tries to overcome the problems.

quote: We can be the very first generation which fails to see the logic or pride in defining ourselves by anything else but what is found within ourselves: our values
author: Germany Kent

quote: Moral action – humble and honest – is the tribute that power must at some point pay to reason.
author: even if you had no title or position.

quote: Perhaps the most important factor of leadership is simply taking advantage of the chance to lead.
author: DeWayne Owens

quote: Listen with the will to learn.
author: Germany Kent

quote: If we do not touch the heart, we will soon weary the ear.
author: Bill Clinton

quote: A sense of messianic purpose makes the national interest almost indistinguishable from the political interests of the president.
author: Heather Simmons

quote: Politics look very simple to the outsider whether he is a businessman or a soldier – it is only when you get into it that all the angles and hard work become apparent. James Forrestal
author: DeWayne Owens

quote: Our deeds and actions can change the heart of men.
author: William R. Forstchen, One Year After

quote: Future shackled is when uncertainty is the enemy that must be beaten into submission.
author: Bill Jensen, Future Strong

quote: Striving for successful goals will have a tendency at times to be discouraging, thankless, and mentally draining. You are entitled to these feelings, however you are not entitled to give up.
author: Ashish Patel

quote: Leaders inspire accountability through their ability to accept responsibility before they place blame.
author: Charles Murray, Coming Apart: The State of White America, 1960-2010

quote: Each decision you make today has the potential to unlock and open doors of profitable benefits or close the doors to great opportunities. Think before you act and make your decisions wisely today.
author: DeWayne Owens

quote: ...What I depend on is a vigorous audience that can discover sweetness and light, beauty and truth, beyond the ability of the artist, on his own, to create them.
author: all other media have space as their element.

quote: In the arts, as in life, everything is possible provided it is based on love.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: Magic is the stunning art of surprising your audience, so that nothing else surprises them.
author: Yukio Mishima, Sun and Steel

quote: Jack was too absorbed in his work to hear the bell. He was mesmerized by the challenge of making soft, round shapes of hard rock. The stone had a will of its own, and if he tried to make it do something it did not want to do, it would fight him, and his chisel would slip, or dig in too deeply, spoiling the shapes. But once he had got to know the lump of rock in front of him he could transform it. The more difficult the task, the more fascinated he was. He was beginning to feel that the decorative carving demanded by Tom was too easy. Zigzags, lozenges, dogtooth, spirals and plain roll moldings bored him, and even these leaves were rather stiff and repetitive. He wanted to curve natural-looking foliage, pliable and irregular, and copy the different shapes of real leaves, oak and ash and birch.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: It is often said that great works of art are “inexhaustible”—capable, as Stanley Olson put it, of “endless interpretation. But Lubin, the Charlotte C. Weber Professor of Art at Wake Forest University, demonstrates in painful if inadvertently hilarious detail that this does not mean that works of art are immune from - that they are not in fact often subject to—wild and perverse misinterpretation.
author: Richie Norton

quote: An artist is a man who digests his own subjective impressions and knows how to find a general objective meaning in them, and how to express them in a convincing form.
author: Atalina Wright, Unbound

quote: She must disappear for a time from the human surface,And sacrifice everything for this, To recreate herself from the depths of her world.
author: David Foenkinos, Charlotte

quote: Many works would be senseless, real junk, but for the fact that, being art, they are exhibited because they have a message of almost religious importance, interpreting man and his world - yes, perhaps even as junk.
author: Jason Innocent

quote: ...human beings are able to attend to issues longer, to think harder about them, to receive deeper impressions that last longer, if information is presented in a context of emotion--a sort of hot dressing--than if it is presented wholly without affect.
author: Charles R. Cross, Heavier Than Heaven: A Biography of Kurt Cobain

quote: Because at nightwhen others are sleeping, I drown myself in poetry.
author: Robert A. Kearse

quote: Remind me who you are,” he said in a gentler tone, almost a please. “How we know each other.”“Okay,” she began. “I’m Savannah Evans, a grad student and teaching assistant who teaches English at a college in Cambridge. I applied to the colony to work on my poetry and arrived six weeks ago. “We’ve spoken many times. You’ve praised my work, which I find a great honor as I’m a fan of your art.
author: Tim Mann artist

quote: We are living in a very complex society. It puts me in a complex frame of thinking.
author: Nuno Roque

quote: The world concerns me only in so far as I owe it a certain debt and duty, so to speak, because I have walked this earth for 30 years, and out of gratitude would like to leave some memento in the form of drawings and paintings—not made to please this school or that, but to express a genuine human feeling.
author: E.M. Forster, Maurice

quote: It does not much matter that an individual loses two or three hundred pounds in buying a bad picture, but it is to be regretted that a nation should lose two or three hundred thousand in raising a ridiculous building.
author: Hugh MacLeod, Ignore Everybody: and 39 Other Keys to Creativity

quote: The ability to find pixilation amid the pixelation is at the essence of the gift of celestial Grace.
author: Ben Shahn

quote: It is well known that in exchange for visionary powers, artists often suffer with extreme sensitivity and violent changeability of temperament. A philosophical crisis, or simply boredom of inactivity, could send [Holmes] spinning into a paralysed gloom from which [I] could not retrieve him.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Reading is just staring at a dead piece of wood for hours and hallucinating.
author: Adele          Rose, Shattered

quote: You can never have too many books or too many hugs.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Make wise choices about what you read. Read only what is necessary or worthwhile. And then take the time to read carefully. One book read with concentration and reflected upon is worth a hundred flashed through without any absorption at all.
author: Diriye Osman

quote: To tidy up takes time, and she wants all her time for wolfing books...
author: Stella Gibbons, Nightingale Wood

quote: I read for pleasureIn search of fictional worldsTo enrich my truths
author: Tethered by Letters

quote: Reading is weightlifting for the brain
author: Rabih Alameddine, An Unnecessary Woman

quote: Because we were Russian, sadness came naturally to us. But so did reading. In my family, a book was a life raft.
author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

quote: a town with more drinking joints than reading joints has a problem reading can solve
author: DarknessAndLight, I Sold Myself To The Devil For Vinyls... Pitiful I Know

quote: I have met many sacred souls in reading.
author: JennAnijah Publishing

quote: If e-book readers were invented before print books, (petty things such as) the smell of ink would have been some people’s only reason for not abandoning e-books.
author: either read or write a story.

quote: Reviewing bad books is bad for the character – WH Auden
author: Sarah Vowell

quote: A good story conveys a message that strengthens our values.
author: Ramakrishna, Sayings of Sri Ramakrishna

quote: What a wonderful world it could be, when spiritual factions would choose to read sacred writings as colorful metaphors and not as bloody declarations of war. (“Is heaven a place in the sky?”)
author: Rumi

quote: Choosing to interpret all your experiences from a place of love will allow you to strengthen and empower yourself, while moving closer to the divine light.
author: Renae A. Sauter, An Empowered Life: Mind/Body/Spirit Empowerment

quote: When we finally become present in our lives its as if we are seeing things for the first time.
author: Srimad Bhagavatam

quote: The ‘knowledge’ (gnan) that was resulting into ‘the things to be known’ (gneya)
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: A country can be reformed only through a spiritual restoration
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: There is only supreme bliss in the Soul, our True Self. But this bliss is obstructed because of impure inner intents.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: No human being really has any misery. It is your own mistake if you complain of the misery.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Children born of Spirit have one Spiritual Father.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: God has said not to create any accounts (karmic). Create accounts (only) if you have the knowledge of the future. Hey! If you want to start an account, then why don’t you account for the possibility that you may die tomorrow?
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: I am neither the mind not the thought, I am its Creator.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: Spencer Tracy, when asked for advice on acting, said, “Know your lines and don’t bump into the furniture.” James Cagney said, “Walk in, plant your feet, look the other fellow in the eye and…tell the truth.” With all due respect to both of these giant talents, I would have to say there’s something more. The true creation of a being, a character other than one’s self, for me is comparable to a mystical or spiritual experience. To stand in another person’s shoes. To see as he sees, to hear as he hears. To know what he knows, and to do all this with a sense of control, a mastering of the dramatic moment, there must be more than a “natural talent” at work.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi

quote: Tempestuous plains tell the tale,Windswept wastes do bewail,Haunting Spirit of the land,Seeks the living, seeks the damned.Horizoned edge sheared with grass,			Dark Storm Rising in the pass,Ageless Spirit seeks the path,To torment souls to the last.Brooding Spirit upon the plain,Thunderhead gathers for the rain.				Light grows dim then bolts with pain,On dry Earth her sin is stained.(Frightened creatures do stampede,Into night, they do recede).Ungodded hand on seasoned blade,Reaps the harvest of the Age.Released from her eternal din,Spirit of the Age rises again.Seeking to plunder and consume,		Those who were proud, those who presumed.Spirits rage while storm draws nigh,Upon burning plain and emblazoned sky.It is said giants grapple in the Earth so deep,To contend for souls that they might keep.		The Storm spirit now searches the high and the low,To seek her manchild victim in the fields below.Leaves bad wasteland to claim but a fallen man,Denying it Heaven, crowning it, ‘Son of the Damned.’Treacherous Spirit of the far lost night,			Tramples souls down denying them light.Storm seethes with furious hiss,Leads men on to bottomless pit.This most ancient of foes has come from her den,To seek the living, to make ready those dead.	A living sacrifice is her soul desire,To snatch the soul for black funeral pyre.A double-damned devil, that is she,This one who lies, who claims to make free.A lying spirit, that is her domain,					A storm-wracked Fury of self-proclaim.Onward she seeks, this bleak Northern wind,Searching for naught but for a soul akin.Amidst the howling and the rage,To murder again, that is her trade.				As this spirit of graves left the plain,She left a wake of dead in shrouded train.			Now down from the plain Storm did come,Unto those cities wherein was no sun.There with whirlwind she did rip and scour,		For those souls of whom she could tear and devour.She comes to seek the living and the dead,Those who were frightened, those with no dread.Thus upon those she did acclaim,“I am the Mistress of the living and the slain.”		O’ haunting Spirit of this land,Taker of life, maker of the damned. --On Villainess Storm, Ch. One Valley of the Damned
author: Ian Baucom, Through the Skylight

quote: The only way to know God, the only way to know the other, is to listen. Listening is reaching out into that unknown other self, surmounting your walls and theirs; listening is the beginning of understanding, the first exercise of
author: Erin Fal Haskell

quote: There is an underlying unity in all things
author: Juliette Power

quote: Conflict forces us to be fully present because it shatters our ego – stripping away all hope of escape or sugar coating. It removes everything that is nonessential to our authentic being; it removes all superficial layers. Conflict is painful because it wakes us up out of our created illusions. And if we lean into it, conflict can be the catalyst to our enlightenment.
author: Meraaqi, Divine Trouble

quote: I am confident in my FAITH because I know the character of God and am assured by the love and mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ
author: C.S. Lewis, The Screwtape Letters

quote: Nothing is free in this world. That which comes before you is your very own.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Sharpen your life always; even though it will come to an end like a pencil, we have to keep on writing
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: The science of the spirit and its relationship to the body in which it indwells is a complex conundrum. Life is not what it appears to be. Life is wholesome, and this unison of synergistic amalgamations persuade the common view that one thing is the other. But one thing is many things - at the one time - and this simple truth goes to the essence of all life with its manifold complexities.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: I invite each of you to let go of your fears for just one day and say YES to life… say YES to love… say YES to You! You can always go back to saying ‘no’ another day.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: If there is wrong [ill] on the inside, the outside will appear wrong. Therefore, you should inquire within ‘why am I bothered, when others are not? So there must be wrong within me only.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: What is the difference between disrespect (avinay) and despise (viradhana)? Disrespect (avinay) means one shows lack of respect and to despise (viradhana) means one becomes an adversary (opponent).
author: this is called the world.

quote: When we are angry, when we are excited, when we are depressed, when we are elated, we are completely submerged in and identified with those thoughts and feelings. This is why we suffer. We suffer because we are completely identified with our thoughts and feelings and we think this is me. This is who I am.
author: Jetsunma Tenzin Palmo

quote: A single thought can shift your entire world.
author: Munia Khan

quote: I am not a victim of circumstance, situation, nor any external condition of life. I am an active participant in the creation of my reality, meaning, I am actively participating in the creation of what I think, what I feel, what I spend my time on, who I spend my time with, what I consume mentally and physically, and all the blessings and contrastive experiences that come my way. Every effect has a cause and every cause has an effect, all of which include me because it is my life to live, my life to use, and my life to enjoy.
author: Anselm of Canterbury

quote: With all control look for the hole, your mind gets weak, unless it’s truth you seek. Swirled and twirled into another world, into the smog, a doorway within the fog.” Deetkatu, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, The Little People Journey into the Mystic Sea

quote: Bad in good and good in bad, see the life you could have had? Your life is the keyhole, and you are the key, don’t look back, NOW choose to be happy!”Deetkatu, Meet the Little People…An Enchanting Adventure
author: Chris DiSano Davenport, See the Little People...An Enchanting Adventure

quote: What is your heart worth to you? The answer is ‘everything’. Our hearts are worth the World.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: It’s important to have a vision of the long run and make wise decisions for our highest good in the present moment; however, we don’t want to become attached to how everything must look. When we show up in good faith, life provides. And when we trust, we are always in the flow of manifestation.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: There is an earthly sun, which is the cause of all heat, and all who are able to see may see the sun; and those who are blind and cannot see him may feel his heat. There is an Eternal Sun, which is the source of all wisdom, and those whose spiritual senses have awakened to life will see that sun and be conscious of His existence; but those who have not attained spiritual consciousness may yet feel His power by an inner faculty which is called Intuition.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: When I Am Within, I Am Never Without.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Close your eyes and trust; go in the direction of what makes you feel authentically lighter and brighter. There is no good or bad. Retribution feels vibrationally better than desperation. It’s better than sitting still because your energy has movement. Frustration is better than retribution, because now you’re not projecting negative energy outward, you’re processing it within. Apathy is better than frustration; at least you’ve reached some form of detachment. Optimism is better than apathy. Optimism becomes happiness. Co-creative inspiration follows… and then comes joy.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The mystery of grace is the power of God.
author: Iman Ghavamabadi

quote: It is the body-complex that eats and one just does the egoism of ‘I ate.’ He is not aware that there is another entity. One simply takes on the suffering of another.
author: Brownell Landrum, A Chorus of Voices: DUET stories Volume III - Adult Version

quote: The moment we accept our pain is the moment we release our suffering. Suffering is created when we offer life resistance, and what we resist most are the experiences that bring us pain.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Your Ego tells you that you were wronged and it validates your separation. Your Higher Self tells you that you were blessed and it validates your expansion.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Every day, I take steps to resolve all my karmic ties, live with intention, smile and laugh often, express my love, and act on what brings me fulfillment. Why wait until we have one foot in the grave to suddenly become spiritual, forgiving, and at peace with the world?
author: Brownell Landrum, The Song Begins: DUET stories Volume I - Adult Version

quote: On the road to success, there is always room to share appreciation and gratitude for other people’s successes. Feeling gratitude for other people raises our own vibration, while adding cement to the bricks we lay. Finding the best qualities in others allows us to build those qualities within ourselves. And when we focus on our personal growth with open hearts and minds, the speed with which we construct dramatically increases, because all the while, we are attracting more like energy and like-minded people into our lives to assist us.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Being under stress is like being stranded in a body of water. If you panic, it will cause you to flail around so that the water rushes into your lungs and creates further distress. Yet, by calmly collecting yourself and using controlled breathing you remain afloat with ease.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: You can see clearly in a sacred dawn of light.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Enlightenment isn’t about reaching a destination of “knowing”, it is about developing consistent vibrational harmony within one’s self and with the surrounding world.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Your anger – about matters that you think are personal and yours alone – is, in fact, the fuel for the machines of war. Your kindness towards strangers on the street is, in fact, the grace and serenity that brings millions of people together to work towards the common good of all.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Through transcendence of duality, we foster greater unity in our lives, which brings about inner peace and the sprouting of unconditional LOVE.
author: Delma Pryce, ABOVE AND BEYOND: My Spiritual Journey

quote: If you find your sacred soul mate, bind the love bond.
author: Earthschool Harmony, Back To Grace

quote: After establishing anything as the absolute truth, its’ conclusion is reached. It doesn’t have to be established as the truth again. What is proven as the eternal established truth for past, present and future is known as the Principle [Siddhant].
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Detachment is being apathetic or aloof to other people, while un-attachment is acknowledging and honoring other people, while choosing not to let them influence your emotional well being. Detached would mean I do not care, while un-attached means I care, although I am not going to alter my emotional state due to your emotions, words, or actions.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Our reality is colored by our vibration and belief systems. In other words, the experiences we have in the world with other people are dictated by the energy we bring with us wherever we go.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: Great humility brings great grace.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: You can survive any situation with strength of spirit and soul.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: With great humility brings great grace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: People who suffer the most often inflict the most pain onto others. Compassion can be found through understanding this. When someone is internally suffering, sometimes the only reality they know is that of pain and thus their only knowledge is how to be a victim or an abuser. That’s all they are able to communicate. Holding onto the thorn of resentment does not help them or you, but fostering compassion and forgiveness will.
author: Munia Khan

quote: Through me, I see you. Through you, I see me.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: The odds are stacked against us until we realize: We make the odds.
author: Jonathan Odell, The Healing

quote: How ironic it is then, to realize how many of we humans are masochists! That even when we are placed in paradise, the majority of us would, by choice, focus on everything outside the present moment and make ourselves suffer by thinking about Dis-Ease! Too many of us would dwell on a past that no longer exists while everything in the present moment is wonderful. What great paradoxes we as humans are capable of!
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Mastering our thoughts can only be achieved after we truly understand what reality is. Thus, it is time to shatter your pre-conceived concept of reality. First, the majority of what you perceive as reality exists only in your mind, and, chances are, you spend most hours of your life in this illusion.
author: Alaric Hutchinson, Living Peace

quote: Illusions can and do create PHYSICAL Dis-Ease within our bodies. So it’s most important to master our thoughts, to become cognizant of what we are spending our precious mental energy on each moment of every day.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Awake to the spiritual realities of life.
author: Dada Bhagwan

quote: The wilderness is a test, whether we will walk in the ways of God.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Intelligence is composed mostly of imagination, insight, things that have nothing to do with reason.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: with rare exceptions (chiefly the social insects), mammals and birds are the only organisms to devote substantial attention to the care of their young; an evolutionary development that, through the long period of plasticity which it permits, takes advantage of the large information-processing capability of the mammalian and primate brains. Love seems to be an invention of the mammals.
author: Kenneth Eade, Political Thriller: Unwanted, an American Assassin Story: an assassination, vigilante justice and terrorism thriller

quote: To be wise means to know when to stay silent.
author: Joe Reyes, Aftermath

quote: Starting over is opportunity informed by failure, which is opportunity made intelligent.
author: Sam Eriakha

quote: And have I not told you that what you mistake for madness is but over-acuteness of the sense?
author: Vishwanath S J

quote: Genius without wisdom is like a plane without wings
author: Joann Greenberg

quote: Gifted people of discernment, intelligence, and talent flourish in virtually every occupation. Every field produces perceptive and prescient persons whom exhibit the rare capacity to observe what eludes most people.
author: James Emlund

quote: It takes a very great intelligence to breathe logical meaning into meaningless ideas.
author: Matt K. Turner, GENESIS

quote: Train your subconscious to be positive by using the heart intelligence.
author: Sultan Salahuddin Ayubi

quote: Love sharpens intelligence, fear dulls it. Who wants you to be intelligent? Not those who are in power. How can they want you to be intelligent?—because if you are intelligent you will start seeing the whole strategy, their games. They want you to be stupid and mediocre. They certainly want you to be efficient as far as work is concerned, but not intelligent; hence humanity lives at the lowest, at the minimum of its potential.
author: John Wyndham

quote: These days we have Smartphones, Smartcars, Smartboards, Smarteverything, but consider this: if technology is getting smarter, does that mean humans are getting dumber?
author: Diana Richardson, Tantric Sex for Men: Making Love a Meditation

quote: He worshipped at the temple of her intellect and I believe it was a comfort to him to know that she left our world with it still shining.
author: Colleen Chen, Dysmorphic Kingdom

quote: I simply love Drosera plants! Those tentacles, I love those tentacles...~ Aarush Kashyap
author: Kalifer Deil

quote: Intelligence is a burden not many are willing or able to carry.
author: Md. Mujib Ullah

quote: Be not proud of your intelligence. Be simple, wise, and humble.
author: Genereux Philip

quote: If an Artist falls in love with you, you will live forever.
author: Criss Jami, Healology

quote: If I was meant to be controlled, I would have come with a remote.
author: Henna Inam, Wired for Authenticity: Seven Practices to Inspire, Adapt, & Lead

quote: What, anyway, was he to say? That intelligence could surpass and excel the blind force of evolution, with its emphasis on mutation, struggle and death? That conscious cooperation was more efficient than feral competition?
author: Christopher Buckley

quote: In our day everyone wants to appear intelligent, one would prefer to be accused of crime than of naiveté if the accompanying risks could be avoided. But since intelligence cannot be drawn from the void, subterfuge are resorted to, one of the most prevalent being the mania for "demystification", which allows an air of intelligence to be conveyed at small cost, for all one need do is assert that the normal response to a particular phenomenon is "prejudiced" and that it is high time it was cleared of the "legends" surrounding it; if the ocean could be made out to be a pond or the Himalayas a hill, it would be done. Certain writers find it impossible to be content with taking note of the fact that a particular thing or person has a particular character or destiny, as everyone had done before them; they must always begin by remarking that "it has too often been said", and go on to declare that the reality is something quite different and has at last been discovered, and that up till now all the world has been "living a lie". This strategy is applied above all to things that are evident and universally known, it would doubtless be too naive to acknowledge in so many words that a lion is a carnivore and that he is not quite safe to meet.
author: and there is no reason to suppose Homo sapiens to have reached the apex of cognitive effectiveness attainable in a biological system.

quote: Profound thinkers either become astute lovers or rebellious spirit
author: Innocent Mwatsikesimbe, The Reason

quote: Ideas are the currency of innovation.
author: Sally Fryer Dietz, When Kids Fly: Solutions for Children with Sensory Integration Challenges

quote: I AM come of a race noted for vigor of fancy and ardor of passion. Men have called me mad; but the question is not yet settled, whether madness is or is not the loftiest intelligence--whether much that is glorious--whether all that is profound--does not spring from disease of thought--from moods of mind exalted at the expense of the general intellect. They who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night. In their gray visions they obtain glimpses of eternity, and thrill, in waking, to find that they have been upon the verge of the great secret. In snatches, they learn something of the wisdom which is of good, and more of the mere knowledge which is of evil. They penetrate, however, rudderless or compassless into the vast ocean of the "light ineffable", and again, like the adventures of the Nubian geographer, "agressi sunt mare tenebrarum, quid in eo esset exploraturi".We will say then, that I am mad.
author: Amit Ray, Meditation: Insights and Inspirations

quote: Unsettling are the days in which everyone is an expert.
author: Mark Frost, The Paladin Prophecy

quote: It was the smile of a man who is able to see, to know and to create the glory of existence. It was the mocking, challenging smile of a brilliant intelligence.
author: Genereux Philip

quote: At best, IQ contributes about 20 percent to the factors that determine life success, which leaves 80 percent to other forces.
author: Francesca Zappia, Made You Up

quote: Knowing the truth is so minuscule compared to having the nerve to say it...and even more to live it.
author: Criss Jami, Healology

quote: Knowledge is all about knowing it and Intelligence is all about using it
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Be according to your possibility.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The source of greatness lies in commitment, persistence, and perseverance.
author: Debasish Mridha

author: Debasish Mridha

author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Peace is not the absence of agonyBut the presence of joy of harmony
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Peace is not only the absence of violence, but the presence of love, kindness, compassion and harmony.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When we will learn to see, not you and me, but only we, then there will be peace in this world.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When we will learn to use our love as a currency to buy the peace, peace will be there.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Faith and beliefs are the common things in all religion, so God is the faith and the belief without exception.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Love with a peaceful mind and bring peace with the power of love.

quote: To win the peace, fight with your love and understanding.

quote: Our spirit is always in peace but our ego is looking for war, so calm the ego and love the spirit forever.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: He is the best fighter who fights with love for the world peace.

quote: When we will learn to emulate the peacefulness of a tree, love of a flower, the earth will be a garden of love and peace.

quote: Until we learn to love everyone in this universe, how can there be peace?
