quote: If we know that we all came from the same place and our destination is the same, then how could there be any conflicts? Why are we are loving each other and why we are not in peace?
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When your mind is tranquil, happy and peaceful, you will find peace everywhere.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When you are in peace with you, you will find the peace everywhere you go.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The practice of love and compassion are the most important treatment for the sickness of hatred and revival of peace in the world.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: If we think about the world peace as much as we think about what to eat next time only for a month, peace will be there.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To find peace, find the love and understanding.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I am the symbol of peaceI am the humanityI am the symbol of goodness I am the communityI am the symbol of changeI am the light in darknessI am the symbol of compassion I am the sole of kindnessI am the symbol of joyful futureI will bring brightnessI am the symbol of unity and harmonyI will bring happiness
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To bring peace in this world, you have to be peaceful with yourself.
author: we may gain the power but not the peace.

quote: A little love, a little kindness,a little hope, a little joyfulness,a little tolerance, a little gratefulness,brings harmony and creates peacefulness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Let us find the way to the peaceLe us make peace, the way of lifeLet us sing the song of peaceLet us dance together with joy of lifeLet us feel and love each otherLet us share and bloom togetherLet us dare to care for who sufferLet us dream a peaceful earth forever.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To find the inner peace be utmost honest to yourself.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Peace begins with understanding and trust.
author: peace is the destination.

quote: Focus on joy, not on hurt or fear.The earth will dance, peace to share.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I dream of a land of peace where everyone can live in harmony.I dream of a land of joywhere everyone can live without agonyI dream of a land of fairy where everyone can live with beauty.I dream of a land of forgiveness where everyone can live with unity. I dream of a land of tranquilitywhere everyone can live with diversity. I dream of a land of lovewhere we can live in peace as a beloved humanity.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I dream of a land of peace where everyone can live in harmony.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Be an instrument of peace, not a preacher of hate.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: It is insanity to expect to live in peace when always we are getting ready for war.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I am the symbol of peace I am the humanityI am the symbol of goodness I am the communityI am the symbol of changeI am the light in darknessI am the symbol of compassion I am the sole of kindnessI am the symbol of joyful futureI will bring brightnessI am the symbol of unity and harmonyI will bring happiness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Focus on peace not on war.Love, live, share and care. Focus on kindness not on hate.Bliss will flow to open the gate.Focus on joy, not on hurt or fear.The earth will dance, peace to share.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: War never can bring peace but a caring heart with love can do that.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Peace is always kind.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Peace is a way of life.Peace is a way of love.Peace is a heart’s forgiveness.Peace is a mind’s kindness.Peace is living in harmony.Peace is living with courtesy.Peace is living with trust.Peace is living with truth and trust.Peace is living with freeness.Peace is living with happiness.

quote: You find peace not by creating but by giving.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Peace is the only destination worth beginning a journey for.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Inner peace begins when nothing can disturb the calmness of your mind.

quote: May you live in peace today and forever.

quote: We always glorify war, but why? We have war memorials everywhere but I never saw a peace memorial yet. We teach our children war game. We let them play game which is not other than a legal war but we expect peace from them. How foolish that could be!

quote: Make peace your purpose of life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Love others, not because they deserve your love, but because you want to win their heart to create enduring peace.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To change the world, see the world through your heart, world will change along with your perception.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Universe is nothing but the reflection of your thoughts and perceptions.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: In the universe, nothing is either beautiful or ugly, but our perception and thinking makes it so.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To change the reality, change the perception but not the reality.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To see a thing as it is, we have to give up our preconceived perception about it.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: We are the pigeons of peace.We are the peacocks of justice.We are the symbols of kindness.We fill the heart with happiness.We love with joy to each other.We will not forget it forever.We are the future
author: we are your children.We will make this world a peaceful garden.

quote: We might have a different height and different color.But we all have parents, so we are brother and sister.We all have a different goal and a different vision.We all like to live in peace and that is our mission.We like to share our love and the world with each other.We like to live in harmony, trust, and peace forever.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: It’s better to live in hell with the wise than in heaven with the wicked.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Don’t try to control yourself, just learn to monitor your thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Accept losing but never give up the hope of winning
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I don’t want to go to heaven. I want to transform the earth to be heaven.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: A problem is an opportunity to find a new way.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: In the darkest sky, stars hang on high; showing us the light of hope and telling us that dreams never die.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: No is a false perception. Yes is a positive conception.Go with reality and reason.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Imagine, then think, then desire, then dream, then act to achieve and it will be yours.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: There is no right or wrong.There is no weak or strong.There is only you.

quote: A simple thought can transform you forever. So cultivate beautiful thoughts, ugliness never.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Making mistakes is important because it makes you wiser.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: A problem is an opportunity to see your life through another window.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: A cynic is a person who sees things as it is
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Most of our life we pass by waiting for tomorrow, but not living for today.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: There are only possibilities
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Create memories every day. You will grow a diamond on the way.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Think your best thoughts every moment, every day. You will be the best person on the way.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When I see the darkness and fight,I want to be the love and light.When I see the sadness and suffering,I want to bring happiness and caring.When I see ignorance and agony,I want to cure it as a great alchemy.When I see frustration and torment,I want to bring opportunities to invent.When I see violence and destruction,I want to win by love with great intention.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You cannot go back and start a brand new beginning, but today is a new day and you can start a brand new thing.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Life is full of joy and beauty. Look around and notice it. Notice the little butterfly, a little baby with a smile, and the white rose in the garden. Notice a drop of dew on a green leaf in the morning sun. Touch the wind, smell the rain, and feel the joy. Live your life with beauty and joy.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I love you, that is important to me. You love me or not its your matter. Remember I can control only myself, not you at all.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I love you because I find myself in you.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Art is an expression of love, which you can see on the canvas.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Music is the language of the heart, the language of the soul, the language of nature and the language of the universe.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Wonder at everything and ask, why?Love everything and wonder, why?
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Silence is the music of the heart.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Always keep hope aliveAlways dream with trust.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I am loving and joyful because I think I am.

quote: In the darkness of night when universe sleepsYou come and play with my stringsNo one can see or feel it but I doYou are my love.

quote: In a very romantic moment,I want only love, not a comment.

quote: In this loveless world, you’re my endless love.

quote: Love or not to loveWhen question ariseLove or not to loveAlways love.

quote: When question ariseHelp or not to helpAlways help.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When you have wings of love to fly,why do you sit in a prison and cry?

quote: Love, kindness, compassion and forgiveness are divine.

quote: Let us create the tsunami of love to flatten the world with joy.
author: touch someone’s heart forever.

quote: It is better to be nonjudgmental. Pure love is always unconditional.

quote: Love is the universal language of heart.Feeling are the universal language of love.Smile is the universal language of charm.Attraction is the universal language of life.

quote: Your heart has all the feelings, all the perception, and all the love that the universe ever had.

quote: To feel the love, open your mind and expand your heart.

quote: Let the blossoms of love beautify your heart.

Without power of love, life is a waterless river. Oh! Let me love forever.Love is the joy and charm.Without beauty of love, life is a lifeless flower.

quote: Love yourself and feel the joy of life.

quote: Love as if you are born to love.
author: love is my drug.I am the rain and love is my earth.

quote: I love you as river loves the ocean.

quote: Be loving to find the love.

quote: Love is pure

quote: When you are looking for love, then love is spreading its net to catch you.

quote: Life is a present; life is a miracle. Life is a song divine.When you touch my heart, hold my soul.Oh my pure valentine.

quote: I love you, not because you are perfect, but because I created a place for you in my heart.

quote: Something good about love: if you fall in it, you will not feel any pain.

quote: See a day,not with the open eyes,but with the open mind from far away.

quote: It is better to win by the power of love than by the power of might.

quote: To fall in love is easy,but forgetting is required to be crazy.

quote: In your love, I dive,to find the beauty of life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Love is what makes you bloom like a flower with a smile, beauty and fragrance.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: One good thing about love, when it touches you, time stands still.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Those who complain never love, those who love, never complain.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You will attract love when you are the source of love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: We love things because they reflect our imaginative love in their expression.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: With the wings of love, flyin the imaginative and joyful blue sky.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Love to see the invisible with trust
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You may hate me from your heart but I will continue to love you to touch your heart.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Tell me, before you call us servants, who served whom? And who, I wonder, in your generations, will immortalize you?
author: Sebastian Faulks, Engleby

quote: He was wearing a little bag of “Mojo” around his neck.
author: Michael A. Hodge

quote: She mourned the history that the invisible intruder had erased, but not enough that she would spend a second more of her future feeling the emptiness.
author: Ahmed Farrag

quote: The pollenless trees were genomed to repel bugs and birds
author: Yunus D. Saleh, Crisis Management: The Art of Success and Failure

quote: We are the middle children of history. Born too late to explore earth, born too early to explore space.
author: Montague Kobbé, The Night of the Rambler

quote: It is tempting to write the history of technology through products: the wheel
author: Siddhartha Mukherjee, The Gene: An Intimate History

quote: One could not see the Greek, the Celt, the Roman, the man of the Renaissance, not even the Victorian on a white face, for Western civilisation had moved too fast to leave any telltale signs of the past on the European skin. She thought: the white face is without history: too familiar, too unremarkable – always modern. But a look at an Indian face sends the mind travelling back a thousand years. The Olmec, the Maya, the Toltec, the Mexica were still there in the coppery skin, the prominent nose, the high cheekbones, the epicanthic fold, the brown eyes staring back from the deep well of time.
author: Ada Limon, Bright Dead Things

quote: The implicit optimism of the [field service post card] is worth noting—the way it offers no provision for transmitting news like “I have lost my left leg” or “I have been admitted into hospital wounded and do not expect to recover.” Because it provided no way of saying “I am going up the line again,” its users had to improvise. Wilfred Owen had an understanding with his mother that when he used a double line to cross out “I am being sent down to the base,” he meant he was at the front again. Close to brilliant is the way the post card allows one to admit to no state of health between being “quite” well, on the one hand, and, on the other, being so sick that one is in hospital.
author: Sarah Brazytis, The Apprentices

quote: History has always been violent, unstoppable and bound to happen; either with or without you. Acknowledge it.
author: Bernard Lewis

quote: Equal rights meant just that, rights for both blacks and women, with the association working for both at the same time. Women should not be told to "stand back and wait." [Frederick] Douglas said that women should be generous and allow the Negro to get his vote first. A young woman in the audience replied that she did not think it generous "to compel women to yield on all questions ... simply because they are women.
author: Alasdair MacIntyre, A Short History Of Ethics: A History Of Moral Philosophy From The Homeric Age To The Twentieth Century

quote: Live your best sacred-life. It is only one-time in history.
author: Valverde MacLean, The Disappearance of Merry: An Historic Australian Goldfield, an Old Romance, an Older Mystery, Present Day Danger

quote: We study the past history, with the conscience of the present environmental changes; we can only predict the future ecological changes, by emergence of the past into the present.
author: Amartya Sen, The Argumentative Indian: Writings on Indian History, Culture and Identity

quote: We had come from lecture halls, school desks and factory workbenches, and over the brief weeks of training, we had bonded together into one large and enthusiastic group. Grown up in an age of security, we shared a yearning for danger, for the experience of the extraordinary. We were enraptured by war.
author: Ernst Jünger, Storm of Steel

quote: He insisted on clearing the table, and again devoted himself to his game of patience: piecing together the map of Paris, the bits of which he’d stuffed into the pocket of his raincoat, folded up any old how.I helped him.Then he asked me, straight out, ‘What would you say was the true centre of Paris?’I was taken aback, wrong-footed. I thought this knowledge was part of a whole body of very rarefied and secret lore. Playing for time, I said, ‘The starting point of France’s roads . . . the brass plate on the parvis of Notre-Dame.’He gave me a withering look.‘Do you take for me a sap?’The centre of Paris, a spiral with four centres, each completely self-contained, independent of the other three. But you don’t reveal this to just anybody. I suppose - I hope - it was in complete good faith that Alexandre Arnoux mentioned the lamp behind the apse of St-Germain-l’Auxerrois. I wouldn’t have created that precedent. My turn now to let the children play with the lock.‘The centre, as you must be thinking of it, is the well of St-Julien-le-Pauvre. The “Well of Truth” as it’s been known since the eleventh century.’He was delighted. I’d delivered. He said, ‘You know, you and I could do great things together. It’s a pity I’m already “beyond redemption”, even at this very moment.’His unhibited display of brotherly affection was of childlike spontaneity. But he was still pursuing his line of thought: he dashed out to the nearby stationery shop and came back with a little basic pair of compasses made of tin.‘Look. The Vieux-Chene, the Well. The Well, the Arbre-a-Liege On either side of the Seine, adhering closely to the line he’d drawn, the age-old tavern signs were at pretty much the same distance from the magic well.‘Well, now, you see, it’s always been the case that whenever something bad happens at the Vieux-Chene, a month later — a lunar month, that is, just twenty-eight days — the same thing happens at old La Frite’s place, but less serious. A kind of repeat performance. An echoThen he listed, and pointed out on the map, the most notable of those key sites whose power he or his friends had experienced.In conclusion he said, ‘I’m the biggest swindler there is, I’m prepared to be swindled myself, that’s fair enough. But not just anywhere. There are places where, if you lie, or think ill, it’s Paris you disrespect. And that upsets me. That’s when I lose my cool: I hit back. It’s as if that’s what I was there for.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The greatest literature is the Biblical stories.
author: Timur Vermes, Er ist wieder da

quote: Because of the collapsing economy of America, it is nearly a mathematical certainty that this ship will soon flounder.
author: every moment is a sacred history.

quote: Improving upon nature is the very essence of plant breeding, and so it goes to the heart of one of the central debates of the human condition: the relationship between humanity and nature and the degree to which the human race has a right (or indeed a responsibility) to change plant life for its own ends.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Sometimes shows became almost obsessively obscure, as with the gooseberry (Ribes uva-crispa) shows of nineteenth-century Britain, when workingmen in the industrial counties of northern England and the Midlands formed themselves into societies, constituted with presidents, secretaries, and stewards, for the purpose of running gooseberry shows—weight being the decisive factor. Quite why this fruit, always something of a minority taste, should become the subject of what only could be described as a cult remains a mystery.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: We are wanderers, place shifters, the cosmic homeless. This is not a modern truth, and Achilles is not some new kind of existentialist hero. It is the oldest truth of all, surviving uncomfortably into the modern world of cities and overkings, diplomacy and accommodation, the power structures and the proliferation of stuff which the Mediterranean world provides.
author: Maurice Paléologue

quote: There is no replay of yesterday.
author: Mary H. Eastman, Dahcotah Life and Legends of the Sioux Around Fort Snelling

quote: Our life today is a history of tomorrow.
author: K.S. Inglis, Observing Australia: 1959���1999

quote: Everyone is born with a different mind and the same heart.
author: Crystal Sykes

quote: In uncertainty I am certain that underneath their topmost layer of frailty men want to be good and want be loved. Indeed most of their vices are attempted short cuts to love.
author: A.H. Septimius, Crowns Of Amara: The Return Of The Oracle

quote: Humans are caught -- in their lives, in their thoughts, in their hungers and ambitions, in their avarice and cruelty, and in their kindness and generosity too -- in a net of good and evil. I think this is the only story we have and that it occurs on all levels of feeling and intelligence. Virtue and vice were warp and woof of our first consciousness, and they will be the fabric of our last, and this despite any chances we may impose of field and river and mountain, on economy and manners. There is no other story. A man, after he has brushed off the dust and chips of his life, will have left only the hard, clean questions: Was it good or was it evil? Have I don well -- or ill?
author: Sandeep Sahajpal

quote: Take the Pyramids. Great blocks of useless masonry, put up to minister to the egoism of a despotic bloated king. Think of the sweated masses who toiled to build them and died doing it. It makes me sick to think of the suffering and torture they represent."Mrs. Allerton said cheerfully: "You’d rather have no Pyramids, no Parthenon, no beautiful tombs or temples—just the solid satisfaction of knowing that people got three meals a day and died in their beds."The young man directed his scowl in her direction. "I think human beings matter more than stones.
author: John Fowles, The Tree

quote: If your nationality is lost, nothing is lost – if your religion is lost, nothing is lost – if your ethnicity is lost, nothing is lost – but if your character is lost, then you are more lost than Donald Trump.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality

quote: Homosexuals are not made, they are born.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality

quote: Homosexuality is immutable, irreversible and nonpathological.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality

quote: Every single voice—no matter how soft the peep—longs to be heard.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Either Civilized or Phobic: A Treatise on Homosexuality

quote: You may be James the American, or Mary the British, or anything else, but before all that, you are a human.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Bengal Tigress: A Treatise on Gender Equality

quote: Awareness levels the playing field. We are all humans doing the best we can.
author: Sharon Salzberg, Real Love: The Art of Mindful Connection

quote: Terrorism is born of fundamentalism not of religion.
author: Abhijit Naskar

quote: In the ancient times, when ignorance was the default mode of thinking, Krishna may have proven to be a glorious figure to be adored and relied on in times of distress, but in the modern world of conscientious humans, no Krishna is higher than the Human Self.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Bengal Tigress: A Treatise on Gender Equality

quote: Your life-blood is humanism. If it flows pure and clear, everything would happen nicely in the world - every defect in the society shall be healed.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Principia Humanitas

quote: The magic that confounds them is humanity. The naturally occurring, slow acting, unpredictably potent product of conscious minds connecting. These madmen want to synthesise love. They want to manufacture it, weaponise it, and use it to control people. It’s such a ludicrous scheme it would be funny if they weren’t trampling the world in pursuit of it.
author: Auliq Ice, World in Hands

quote: Like Aurelia, he is a lover of humanity in all its quirks and foibles, quick to delight and slow to judge.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: Human are best protector or worst destroyer of nature and humanity itself
author: GE Paulus

quote: As long as we don’t buckle under the weight of the pain and its longevity, when the pain does subside a bit, we find ourselves more inclined to feel compassion for other people going through their own rough spots - CHALLENGES INSPIRE COMPASSION.
author: Auliq-Ice

quote: The remotest place on Earth can sometimes be the most attractive place on Earth especially in times when our belief in humanity is lost!
author: John Dewey

quote: We are all bits and pieces of history and literature and international law.
author: Jon Chopan, Pulled from the River

quote: You want to become a better person?Just give thanks. Give thanks for all of it.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The God Parasite: Revelation of Neuroscience

quote: In the hands of thinking humanity, the purpose of the tool of Divinity or Religion is not the service of bookish doctrines, but the realization of the self.
author: Abhijit Naskar

quote: Bring light to the ignorant, but more light to the educated, for the vanity of education makes modern humans more ignorant than the ignorant.
author: Kambiz Shabankare

quote: Without the law commanding good there could be no evil. But the same law makes it possible for the creature to exist. Without the law man would sink into nothingness
author: Vikram Singh Slathia

quote: A dictator in a country is a big threat to the whole humanity
author: Sandesh Hukpachongbang

quote: This may be the curse of the human race, not that we are so different from one another, but that we are so alike.
author: Blake Crouch, The Last Town

quote: Oh human creatures, born to soar aloft,Why fall ye thus before a little wind?
author: Gabbo De La Parra

quote: Evolution is constant. Evolving better is individual’s conscience.
author: Benjamin H. Bratton, The Stack: On Software and Sovereignty

quote: It is up to us to decide what human means, and exactly how it is different from machine, and what tasks ought and ought not to be trusted to either species of symbol-processing system. But some decisions must be made soon, while the technology is still young. And the deciding must be shared by as many citizens as possible, not just the experts. In that sense, the most important factor in whether we will all see the dawn of a humane, sustainable world in the twenty-first century will be how we deal with these machines a few of us thought up and a lot of us will be using.
author: Kilroy J. Oldster, Dead Toad Scrolls

quote: A great paradox which should God make us understand, we will weep, laugh, wonder and ponder is the paradox of human ignorance
author: Becky Masterman, Fear the Darkness

quote: In reality, we live in everyone. I live in you. You live in me. There is no gap, no distance. We all are eternally one.
author: Krista Tippett, Becoming Wise: An Inquiry into the Mystery and Art of Living

quote: It’s a wonder of human behavior: we build our own handcuffs that trap and harm us. We create the myth, and we honor it. We tell the lie, and we believe it.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Let borders become sunlight so we traverse this Earth as one nation and drive the darkness out.
author: Kamand Kojouri

quote: Embrace the fearful souls with faith.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Though the stupid have great capacity to direct the world because they are plentiful, the clever has a much greater capacity to prevent the stupid from halting the progression of humanity because - though they are rare - they are tactical and intelligent!
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Giving is an open gate to a great life.
author: Dr. J. Otis Yoder, Biblical Economics

quote: We could give each other a hope, if we communicate with each other in the school, supermarket, bus, train, plane….!
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Angels are just beyond us. They’re creatures that biology doesn’t apply to. They don’t love humanity at all. They just love God.
author: Thomas Jefferson, Works of Thomas Jefferson. Including The Jefferson Bible, Autobiography and The Writings of Thomas Jefferson (Illustrated), with Notes on Virginia, Parliamentary ... more.

quote: Why people want stuff which make them transcendent or transcendence?? And then they just destroy it?? Why Humanity wants something and then destroy it?? THere are a lot of examples one of them is the film "Transcendence
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: With faith, I love without any fear.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Patience was part of his nature, and he accepted his lot as a short-lived mammal, scurrying in and out amid the roots of the giants.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Terrorism has no nationality or religion.I stand with all countries affected by these inhumane acts.Because of this; I am not France, I am not Belgium, nor am I Syria. I am what is left of humanity.I am compassion, I am kindness, I am love. I am the strength that those in fear rely on. I am the fight against terror.
author: bell hooks

quote: We are all unique, but we are also a part of the common body of humanity. With harmony, love, kindness, and compassion we can live together in joy and happiness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: What had human beings become? Did war make us evil or just activate an evil already lurking within us?
author: W.H. Auden, Another Time

quote: Dear Fellow Human Being,You are born wild, You do not deserve to be tamed!Tell yourself,You do not deserve this!All those toxic words you have to listen from people,All those fears they try to pin on your mind,All those giggles they aim at your dreams,All those judgmental stares inspecting your individuality,All those fingers pointing towards your crude character,All those shackles that tie your feet to social expectations,All those cages that do not let your imagination fly free,Listen deeply, you do not deserve any of it.My dear fellow human, you do not deserve this hostility.You are born wild, You do not deserve to be tamed!― Jasz Gill
author: J. Leigh Bralick, A Dark So Deep

quote: More commonly suffering breaks people, crushes them, and is simply unilluminating. You see how gruesomely human beings are destroyed by pain, when they have the added torment of losing their humanity first, so that their death is a total defeat...
author: Randolph Randy Camp, 29 Dimes: A Love Story

quote: No matter what gifts you have, practice is the only way to get better at anything."If people knew how hard I had to work to gain my mastery it would not seem so wonderful at all” - Michael Angelo
author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha

quote: One by one, the electric lights ringing the lawn were ignited. Each one, as it burst into brilliance, erased a constellation from the evening sky.
author: Miyuki Miyabe, The Gate of Sorrows

quote: As it was universal truth no one can control the power of nature, it was useless to mourn when rain poured heavily when it was least needed.
author: Oddný Eir, Land of Love and Ruins

quote: There’s a land—﻿oh, it beckons and beckons,  And I want to go back—﻿and I will.
author: Rachel Carson, Silent Spring

quote: The place has entered me...it has coloured my life like a stain.
author: Henry Miller

quote: There are times when the unseen can be even more dangerous than what our eyes behold.
author: David Eddings, Crystal Gorge

quote: …I have never seen mountains before, and they fill me and oppress me so much that I could not sleep; I must keep awake this first night, and see that they don’t fall on the earth and overwhelm it." [- Miss Benson to her brother, Thurstan]
author: Rebecca Donovan, What If

quote: I never think that I am the one who must see to it that cherries grow on stalks
author: Caroline Kepnes, Hidden Bodies

quote: The endless ocean was his sole companion , and on some deeply sentimental level, it seemed sufficient. Almost apt. He aligned himself with Thoreau and Tolstoy, he felt like their peers. The kinship with nature devoted humans to a mythical state, a heightened persona beyond the reach of mere mortals. At least that was what he told himself on the lonely nights when insomnia played on his fears and the howling wind pierced through his soul.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: We are like travelers using the cinders of a volcano to roast their eggs.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Over the drop, a luminous pond lay below them like a pale magic lantern. It was as if the moon had plummeted into the water and smashed open. Engulfed in darkness, with only a scatter of stars above, the place felt like a bright secret – something ancient and precious.
author: Sara Sheridan, On Starlit Seas

quote: A flock of small birds took off from the wall of the fort. They moved like a length of dark silk caught by the breeze as they headed out to sea. Behind them, the sky was the colour of forget-me-nots. The sun blazed.
author: Elena Ferrante

quote: No man is as wise as Mother Earth. She has witnessed every human day, every human struggle, every human pain, and every human joy. For maladies of both body and spirit, the wise ones of old pointed man to the hills. For man too is of the dust and Mother Earth stands ready to nurture and heal her children.
author: an enchanting lullaby:Mercy lies in nature’s hands and bound to it we grow.Of the earth we came to be and of the earth we’ll go.

quote: We have found that no modern prescriptions heal the human heart so fully or so well as the prescription of the Ancient Ones. "To the hills," they would say. To which we would add, "To the trees, the valleys, and the streams, as well." For there is a power in nature that man has ignored. And the result has been heartache and pain.
author: not directed.

quote: At the end of our lives, when our bodies are about to be laid in Mother Earth, we will know for ourselves whether we are a Two-Legged being full of light or a Two-Legged being full of darkness.
author: Mehmet Murat ildan

quote: River is river.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Summer is more wooing and seductive, more versatile and human, appeals to the affections and the sentiments, and fosters inquiry and the art impulse. Winter is of a more heroic cast, and addresses the intellect. The severe studies and disciplines come easier in winter. One imposes larger tasks upon himself, and is less tolerant of his own weaknesses...The simplicity of winter has a deep moral. The return of nature, after such a career of splendor and prodigality, to habits so simple and austere, is not lost either upon the head or the heart. It is the philosopher coming back from the banquet and the wine to a cup of water and a crust of bread.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Reconnect with nature and be restored.
author: Anuradha Bhattacharyya, One Word

quote: The star rises from the east. Watch out!
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Everyday nature is drawing a new picture just to keep herself alive and pretty.
author: Christyl Rivers

quote: I barely took a moment to appreciate nature. Come to think of it, theonly time I did it was when I was so upset I wanted to commit suicide in theHuang Pu river.
author: Sándor Márai, Embers

quote: May you love blossom like a lily.
author: Seré Prince Halverson, All the Winters After

quote: Naked you are blue like the night in Cuba,you have vines and stars in your hair,
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge, Christabel

quote: Earth, water, fire, and wind. Where there is energy there is life.
author: Timothy Salter, The Sonnets

quote: Our Nature is so Beautiful that we come eyes to short if we be on the right place.Jan Jansen
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: I never knew the wonders of nature, until I began to walk with nature.
author: William Trevor, The Love Department

quote: Given that the human soul is the very core of our human nature, we might note that, when we are guided by soul, we are guided by nature. Both soul and greater nature do guide us in our individual development, whether or not we ask for this guidance.
author: William Faulkner, Go Down, Moses

quote: .....The biggest mystery of nature is nature.
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, The Great Pearl of Wisdom

quote: Peace beginsWhen expectation ends.
author: Henry David Thoreau, A Week on the Concord and Merrimack Rivers

quote: Well, if that’s what you call being at peace, for heaven’s sake just warn me before you go to war, will you?
author: Eleanor Hallowell Abbott, The Indiscreet Letter

quote: We work for peace every time we exercise authority with wisdom and authentic love.
author: Gioconda Belli, The Inhabited Woman

quote: Seek peace.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin, The Dispossessed

quote: If there is no love for others, love of country is just a slogan.
author: Timothy Pina, Bullying Ben: How Benjamin Franklin Overcame Bullying

quote: Dear God, I ask that today and every day that follows you wash any anger from my heart. I desperately want to look at the world differently. Please help me understand that this anger is hurting me more than anyone else. Teach me to find love in every situation and then to find peace in my heart for the rest of my life. In Jesus’s name, amen.
author: Amit Ray, Peace on the Earth  A Nuclear Weapons Free World

quote: You have to make peace with the fact that you have the right to be here, not because you have what it takes, but because your existence was authorised by the heavens.
author: Steven Pinker, The Better Angels of Our Nature: Why Violence Has Declined

quote: Although it is easy to imagine happiness as the upwards turn on this haphazard rising and falling of emotion which is life, but really it is a foundation of strength of character and inner balance that precipitates peace, a foundation that is slowly built or slowly chipped away. There are times when it may seem that the foundation of happiness is broken, but as the dust settles and the debris is cleared away, we find that the storm has only covered it, still leaving everything we have built in place. True happiness is forged in the furnace of perseverance, fortitude, hope and love. It is not burned or broken by the heat, rather it is made unbreakable—it becomes eternal. Life is the fuel for this purifying fire.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Islamophobic Civilization: Voyage of Acceptance

quote: Gratitude is one of the most powerful human emotions. Once expressed, it changes attitude, brightens outlook, and broadens our perspective.
author: Margarita Engle, The Firefly Letters

quote: Sweep your mind and clean your heart, for these are the very places where things that make or mar our entire journey of life and living dwell! Sweep your mind and clean your heart, then you shall be free to be free and indeed have a true freedom! Sweep your mind and clean your heart, so you may have a clean mind and heart to be clean! Sweep your mind and clean your heart for not all things deserve a place in your heart and body! Sweep your mind and clean your heart, for in the end, so many things living in your heart and mind may never matter as part of the matters of your lifetime and life which really matter! Clean your heart and sweep your mind for certain people and things are in there only to disturb you for all the moments they shall continue to live there! Sweep your mind and clean your heart, for your body deserves nothing, but a clean mind and a clean heart daily for a daily fresh and refreshed body! Sweep your mind and clean your heart for there are so many toxic substances in our minds and hearts which we ponder over and over every day that weaken not just our hearts and minds every day, but our entire daily life and living! Sweep your mind and clean your heart for certain things deserve to live permanently in our hearts and minds so as to enable us live and leave distinctive footprints, and certain things deserve to leave our hearts and minds so that we can have a safe journey of life, and live and leave distinctive footprints in our journey of life!
author: Yitzhak Rabin

quote: To live in peace is to follow peace with all men
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: In the hands of blood-sucking monsters a scripture becomes a weapon that takes away humanism from the heart of humans and fills them with hate, rage and selfishness, whereas, in the hands of modern human beings the same scripture can become the greatest philosophical tool to endow the species with goodness and compassion.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Islamophobic Civilization: Voyage of Acceptance

quote: Make a liberty without the instinctive duress.
author: Akshay Vasu

quote: It doesn’t matter whether you are looking for a reason to be happy or sad, you will always find it.
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru

quote: The transcendental state of Absolute Oneness sets the human mind free.
author: Abhijit Naskar, Love, God & Neurons: Memoir of a scientist who found himself by getting lost

quote: Peace cannot prevail without bloodsheds.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah, Religion, Philosophy and life

quote: I am satisfied-For the peace that has graciously engulfed my tender heart.I am home-Because of the abundance of love that I have given myself.I am enlightened-For the journey I have embarked in knowing my higher self.I am complete-Because I now realize that I was always whole.
author: Karen A. Baquiran

quote: Peace of mind is power of being.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Why is it that blood, rather than peace, sells?
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: A peculiar sort of chaos looms beneath the pretense of peace.
author: Bert McCoy

quote: Love gives us happiness, peace then it gives us a lot of pain and you also have to sacrifice your happiness, then you began to hate that person, so fall for friendships. Respect each other’s space and styles, then hangout and enjoy
author: Toni Sorenson, Aligned By Christ

quote: Stay in the light, as those who seek to stay in the dark cannot touch you! - Inshan Meahjohn
author: Inshan Meahjohn

quote: When you fill life with mourning and complaints, your accomplishments will be a little lower than success.
author: Saminu Kanti

quote: We will find true peace only when we learn to see that there is no difference among ourselves, realize that we are different manifestations of one, and we love each other as brother and sister.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Once you go silent everyone starts misinterpreting what your silence says.
author: Adriano Bulla

quote: Real peace is not just a matter of structures and mechanisms. It rests above all on the adoption of a style of human coexistence marked by mutual acceptance and a capacity to forgive from the heart. We all need to be forgiven by others, so we must all be ready to forgive. Asking and granting forgiveness is something profoundly worthy of every one of us,
author: John Scalzi, Questions for a Soldier

quote: Maybe if we just lay beneath the stars long enough, all our worries will dissipate into the cosmos. And we can lay there motionless, yet sailing across the stars.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: We being satiate with continual wars, let the desire of peace a little move us.
author: ― Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Some offer their out-flowing breath into the breath that flows in; and the in-flowing breath into the breath that flows out; they aim at Pranayama, breath-harmony, and the flow of their breath is in peace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Somewhere along the way, there develops within the soul a yearning that can no longer be ignored, a craving for the great love affair. We feel it drawing ever closer. It is the greatest of them all. It cannot fail. It is all consuming. It is incomparable. It is the love affair with our own true nature and the source from which it comes. The desire is in all of us but, more often than not, it is ignored for other interests. We wrestle with each interest, trying to make it work, growing with each adventure until the light has grown bright enough for us to reach for it.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: When we declare war for peace, we may win the war and lose the battle.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: Arin, are you all right?""How?" He managed. "How did her arm break?""She fell of a ladder."He must have visibly relaxed, because his cousin raised her brows and looked ready to scold. "I imagined something worse," he tried to explain.She appeared to understand his relief that pain, if it had to come, came this time without malice. Just and accident. Done by no one. The luck, sometimes of life. A bad slip that ends with bread, and someone to bind you.
author: Andreas Laurencius, Genesis

quote: One day, I would like to turn on the news and hear, there is Peace on Earth.
author: Safa (Me)

quote: Doomed people celebrate peace with sky bombs.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: I shall write peace upon your wings,and you shall fly around the worldso that children will no longer haveto die this way.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The choices you make in life creates your destiny.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To the infra-human specimens of this benighted scientific age the ritual and worship connected with the art of healing as practiced at Epidaurus seems like sheer buncombe. In our world the blind lead the blind and the sick go to the sick to be cured. We are making constant progress, but it is a progress which leads to the operating table, to the poor house, to the insane asylum, to the trenches. We have no healers – we have only butchers whose knowledge of anatomy entitles them to a diploma, which in turn entitles them to carve out or amputate our illnesses so that we may carry on in cripple fashion until such time as we are fit for the slaughterhouse. We announce the discovery of this cure and that but make no mention of the new diseases which we have created en route. The medical cult operates very much like the war office – the triumphs which they broadcast are sops thrown out to conceal death and disaster. The medicos, like the military authorities, are helpless; they are waging a hopeless fight from the start. What man wants is peace in order that he may live. Defeating our neighbor doesn’t give peace any more than curing cancer brings health. Man doesn’t begin to live through triumphing over his enemy nor does he begin to acquire health through endless cures. The joy of life comes through peace, which is not static but dynamic. No man can really say that he knows what joy is until he has experienced peace. And without joy there is no life, even if you have a dozen cars, six butlers, a castle, a private chapel and a bomb-proof vault. Our diseases are our attachments, be they habits, ideologies, ideals, principles, possessions, phobias, gods, cults, religions, what you please. Good wages can be a disease just as much as bad wages. Leisure can be just as great a disease as work. Whatever we cling to, even if it be hope or faith, can be the disease which carries us off. Surrender is absolute: if you cling to even the tiniest crumb you nourish the germ which will devour you. As for clinging to God, God long ago abandoned us in order that we might realize the joy of attaining godhood through our own efforts. All this whimpering that is going on in the dark, this insistent, piteous plea for peace which will grow bigger as the pain and the misery increase, where is it to be found? Peace, do people imagine that it is something to cornered, like corn or wheat? Is it something which can be pounded upon and devoured, as with wolves fighting over a carcass? I hear people talking about peace and their faces are clouded with anger or with hatred or with scorn and disdain, with pride and arrogance. There are people who want to fight to bring about peace- the most deluded souls of all. There will be no peace until murder is eliminated from the heart and mind. Murder is the apex of the broad pyramid whose base is the self. That which stands will have to fall. Everything which man has fought for will have to be relinquished before he can begin to live as man. Up till now he has been a sick beast and even his divinity stinks. He is master of many worlds and in his own he is a slave. What rules the world is the heart, not the brain, in every realm our conquests bring only death. We have turned our backs on the one realm wherein freedom lies. At Epidaurus, in the stillness, in the great peace that came over me, I heard the heart of the world beat. I know what the cure is: it is to give up, to relinquish, to surrender, so that our little hearts may beat in unison with the great heart of the world.
author: M.F. Moonzajer, LOVE, HATRED AND MADNESS

quote: There is nothing dishonorable about abandoning pain. Sometimes peace is most quickly found when a man simply stops avoiding it.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Peaceful society, peaceful world.
author: Asa Don Brown, Waiting to Live

quote: I refuse to accept the view that mankind is so tragically bound to the starless midnight of racism and war that the bright daybreak of peace and brotherhood can never become a reality... I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Heart Crush

quote: We always desire peace yet we prepare to go to war.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Create new avenues in your life by removing toxic people who defeat your purpose.
author: Charles Manson

quote: The world we have created, has problems, that can not be resolved by rich getting richer but by sharing we can over come the problems" Dr. Ron Harris - 2008
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: As a flower expresses thanks with her beauty and fragrance for her magnificent life, let us express our gratitude to every friend with our service and love and to the Earth for her hospitality and care. Let us be thankful and let us express the deepest gratitude for our magnificent life. No matter where you are, I wish you all a very happy Thanksgiving filled with profound joy and endless peace.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You ought to pause and enjoy the peace in the moment.
author: Albert Camus, The Plague

quote: The bond of love, we unite the world.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind

quote: Are you for peace? The great test of your devotion to peace is not how many words you utter on its behalf. It’s not even how you propose to deal with people of other countries, though that certainly tells us something. To fully measure your “peacefulness” requires that we examine how you propose to treat people in your own backyard. Do you demand more of what doesn’t belong to you? Do you endorse the use of force to punish people for victimless “crimes”? Do you support politicians who promise to seize the earnings of others to pay for your bailout, your subsidy, your student loan, your child’s education or whatever pet cause or project you think is more important than what your fellow citizens might personally prefer to spend their own money on? Do you believe theft is OK if it’s for a good cause or endorsed by a majority? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then have the courage to admit that peace is not your priority. How can I trust your foreign policy if your domestic policy requires so much to be done at gunpoint?
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Christmas is the spirit of love, peace and goodwill to all Humankind.
author: Henry Johnson Jr

quote: God’s presence in our lives gives us peace and joy.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Stay united in love.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: NO TRUTH, NO LIGHTNo truth, no equality. No equality, no justice. No justice, no peace. No peace, no love. No love, only darkness.
author: J.C. Cooper

quote: Peace in the home is the peace for the community.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The act of communicating with one another is the beginning of friendship.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: May the love in your heart overshadow any sorrows, and may you always know with a deep inner certainty, how loved you truly are.
author: Gena Showalter, A Mad Zombie Party

quote: God would prefer us all to be united than divided. The devil would prefer us all to be divided than united. God prefers the man who loves than the one who hates. The devil prefers the man who hates than the one who loves.
author: Toni Morrison, Beloved

quote: Resist any form of oppression.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Release The Ink

quote: When the power of LOVE is more important than the love of money, religion and power, and people realize that the most important things in this life are NOT things,the world will finally know peace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: In the horrors of war, please bring me peace.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: With gentleness, you will calm every aggressive action.
author: M.F. Moonzajer

quote: Your happiness is my happiness.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Entrepreneurial capitalism takes more people out of poverty than aid.
author: Sheldon Richman

quote: Which countries contain the most peaceful, the most moral, and the happiest people? Those people are found in the countries where the law least interferes with private affairs; where government is least felt; where the individual has the greatest scope, and free opinion the greatest influence; where administrative powers are fewest and simplest; where taxes are lightest and most nearly equal, and popular discontent the least excited and the least justifiable; where individuals and groups most actively assume their responsibilities, and, consequently, where the morals of admittedly imperfect human beings are constantly improving; where trade, assemblies, and associations are the least restricted; where labor, capital, and populations suffer the fewest forced displacements; where mankind most nearly follows its own natural inclinations; where the inventions of men are most nearly in harmony with the laws of God; in short, the happiest, most moral, and most peaceful people are those who most nearly follow this principle: Although mankind is not perfect, still, all hope rests upon the free and voluntary actions of persons within the limits of right; law or force is to be used for nothing except the administration of universal justice.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Release The Ink

quote: Sex is a powerful intent to create: the creation of pleasure, creation of love, and ultimately the creation of life. It connects and syncs two beings emotionally, physically, and mentally and is one of the strongest expressions of love that exists in this World.
author: Forrest Curran

quote: The law of attraction is synonymous to the law of sacrifice, in which you get in return what you are decisively choose to give up. The universe in all her infinity beauty generously opens up gates that you had no idea existed when you close others, but she requires you to walk through the gates solely on your own will and strength, with the other doors that you have left behind often times being forever locked and eternally inaccessible.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: When we fail to tend to the fragilities of a flower as we become distracted by the noise of our minds, our plant is essentially dying. The quintessence of dying in the sense that we are failing to be mindful of the present moment, for life is the paradox of both living and dying concurrently. Just as we are living each moment, we are dying with every moment, and the essence of living is within each breath that ultimately comprises life as a whole.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: The beauty of traveling is understood along the way rather than at the end of the journey, just as the purpose of marriage isn’t about becoming Mr. and Mrs.’s, but is about the love that is expressed on a daily basis between two lovers. A journey is not made up of the destinations that we arrive at, but is composed within every step and each breath we make.
author: Forrest Curran

quote: With maps and globes decorated around your room as a child and with passport and ticket in hand in the present, it is your world to explore. To travel is to ask for a complex mix of the new and the old, hellos and goodbyes, and sadness and happiness. Leave your shoes behind at home and to walk in the footsteps of others for a while.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Nobody thought it could be done, so nobody had tried before. Standing with one foot in the abyss and the other with a foothold in her dreams, she stood on the edge of a cliff. She took one look behind and with one last deep breath, she leapt with reckless certainty and decisive confidence. Blurring through the sky, for a moment she looked like she would fade into darkness, but in the very last moment when everyone else had given up on her, from her back spread wings. With a leap of faith, she learned to fly.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Is the sunrise of Mount Fuji more beautiful from the one you see in the countryside a bit closer to home? Are the beaches of Indonesia really that much more serene than those we have in our own countries? The point I make is not to downplay the marvels of the world, but to highlight the notion of the human tendency in our failure to see the beauty in our daily lives when we take off the travel goggles when we are home. It is the preconceived notion of a place that creates the difference in perception of environments rather than the actual geological location.
author: Forrest Curran

quote: Although the future is indiscernible, we often feel the need to plan for what cannot be planned, and attempt to react to things that never happened. Our overemphasis in the future is a mere illusion, which often makes us foolishly blind to the beauty of the present moment, and is the root of creating the worst case scenarios and the what- if situations that plague the mind.
author: Forrest Curran

quote: The journey is made up of the most genuine and honest wonders of the mind, but also includes unfathomable sorrow and despair; yet, this is what makes up a journey as well as the human experience in entirety.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Our journey is our breath that makes up the seconds, the emotions that are in the minutes, and our purpose that make up the hours. Stay true to yourself in each moment, and remain vigilant to your purpose in every instant. Our journey begins with the first breath and thereby by every breath that follows.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: At times we will be asked to let go of things that we have always wanted to keep for ourselves, or things that we would never have thought that we would to have to let go of, such as the loss of a loved one or the betrayal of a dear friend. A tree never hesitates to shake off her leaves during fall, and so we must take another lesson given to us by the nature: let go when it is time. Although such losses can be difficult and painful, rise above this suffering. Focus within your mind, the image of the Lotus prospering above mud. We are the lotus; rise above.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Let the people talk, let people doubt, and letpeople question you, but never allow yourself to quit walking your path. Their path is their own and the path you walk is that of your own. Sweet child of mine, be the brave child of mine.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Plunging into the depths of hell, re-opening the gates to wounds and emotions that we have long tried to keep sealed and locked within, we discover that that the devil is not the Herculean ruler of darkness that we had imagined, but only a vulnerable and devastated child. With honesty and without judgment, we must muster the courage to meet this innocent child with whom we have come to label as the devil.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: In life hard times will befall you that will create doubt in yourself, and life will ask questions of the authenticity of the person you are. Carrying the lotus means being true to yourself and in the realization that you were always meant to grow above this mud. We are meant to grow, progress, and evolve in this relentless environment of the World and through it all achieve happiness with grace in letting go. Carry the Lotus within; grow and rise above from the harsh and remorseless world beneath you.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: I didn’t know that the times we spent together on the weekends, the times that we laughed together, and the times you helped me out was your way of silently wishing me a beautiful goodbye.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Breathe in, breathe out. All the blessings of the universe that we may overlook are contained in the entirety of a breath. Breathe in, breathe out. Each breath is the sun flowering our earth, fresh water filling our oceans, and the blue skies clearing our minds. Infinite emotions are contained within every breath, and by the breath we can always realize the beauty within it all. Breathe in, breathe out.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Life was the gift that you were given the day you were born, and in turn you are the gift to life. Only in the moments of being alone in the darkness on the raft, will you have the space to speak, listen, and to act from the heart.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Acknowledge and accept that there will be chaotic times while being on your raft from being lost in true freedom. Engulfed by darkness at sea, we are consumed by a great loneliness that has consistently existed even when people surrounded us, and that is when we must throw all that is heavy into the water, and float independently through to the present.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: Without waiting for others acknowledge your purpose, remaining balanced when things don’t work out, and uncompromising in your effort; realize that you have a piece of the universe for which she cannot exist without.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: You can conquer any aggressive action, with restraint and patient.
author: Alan Kinross, Longinus The Vampire: Babylon

quote: Mankind is one human family.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: We are in the world to complement each other.
author: it is important what you think about yourself.

quote: I may not believe in magic, but I know words have the magical power to change a person or a life in a second.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Meditation is a magical way to merge the finite mind with the universal infinite mind.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You came to this world with nothing, and you will leave this world with nothing. There is nothing to gain or lose. You can only touch everyone and everything with your love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Everything that happens in our lives has meaning even though we may not understand it or even pay attention to it.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To achieve greatness, we must overcome the fear of failure and dare to take great risks.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Innovation has beauty in it. The speed of innovations is getting faster and faster. Remember that ideas are the seeds of innovation.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Treat yourself like someone who is amazingly special. You are special!
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: By changing—we become what we always wanted to be.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I would rather be kind than wise.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: A great person defines himself
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Be like the moon—reflect lights of love from within.
author: do not give up.

quote: To improve your being, appreciate yourself for simplest of reasons.
author: anything else is the manifestation of love.

quote: Only the great power of love can make you great.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Dear Moon, Slowly enlighten my heart with your lovely, silvery, dancing, miraculous light.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The highest form of wisdom is to be simple and live in the beauty of love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To create happiness all around, be loving to all.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Defined purpose oriented actions, not actions, are the attributes of success.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The presence of a good friend brings big smiles.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I often want to drink a cup of moonlight so that I may calm my heart and soothe my mind.
author: you were born here and with an abundance.

quote: Use your love to change the world, but never change your love for any reason.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Be to believe, feel to love, and create to inspire.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: If you are alive, then you have a reason to smile.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Without love and forgiveness, how could there be happiness?
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When you share your truth and your thoughts, you color the universe with your heart.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: If you ever want to love someone, love yourself unconditionally first.
author: always remember to love yourself.

quote: Love yourself first to fill your heart with bliss. Now give it away with humility, love, and gratitude.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Even though we know we have to let you go, our hearts are singing the song no- no- no. We can’t let you go.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: An ocean does not know how big she is just like you don’t know how loving and amazing you are.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You may not need to tell me, I can hear your song better when your voice is silent and your heart is singing.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: After death, I will lose my opportunity to complain so I will accept everything with love.
author: they are your precious property.

quote: Poverty will leave you when you are ready to welcome opportunities.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: If you understand the desire of a blooming flower, you will be able to understand the meaning of life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Always remember that we are here to be kind, loving, and forgiving. We are here to enjoy the abundant ecstasy of life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Live for possibilities. Live with passion and purpose.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Truth is the flower of adversity.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Write what you believe to be true
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Truth has no duality.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: There is no fact or fiction, reality or illusion, there is only the trick of perception.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You can never hide your attitude so be generous. Always show your best attitude and life will be beautiful.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Don’t fall in love because it is slippery, fall in love to find yourself.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Men have a mission to win
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Life happens
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Be generous like the ocean with your love. Let the whole world enjoy the abundance.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The fire of love is the best purifier.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: It is difficult to live without judging others. If you have to judge, then judge with love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The fear of failure is worse than the failure itself. So be bold and courageous.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Time is on its eternal journey at the same time it is motionless, emotionless and standing still.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: With profound love, kindness, and harmony trees are endlessly extending their blessings. That is why we are still living.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Only when you are able to hear the songs of a tree will you be able to understand the magnificence and magic of life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: This universe is a dancing stage for consciousness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Don’t fear! Take care of revenge and hatred by hitting the haters with love and kindness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To be respected, respect others.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: What begins will eventually end. The gap between is life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The morality of a society is often dangerous and very unethical.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Integrity is a virtue which defines the depth of life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You may not be able to find love, but if you give, you will get it back in return.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To reach the pinnacle of success, you have to cross the treacherous valleys of failures and discontent.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Spring shows the power and love of the earth
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Now I am going to fly toward the unknown with the wings of my love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Don’t let the opinions of others interfere with your true perception.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Turn an impossibility into an exciting reality.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: You are my sunshine on a dark dreary day.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To be good, see goodness in everyone.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The best way to create a future is to set a goal and take action.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Music can touch and heal that secret wound of the soul which nothing else can reach.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: I want to be born and reborn as a cherry tree so that I may beautify this world with my blossoms, feed everyone with my nectar of love fruits, and purify the air with my calmly dancing leaves.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Excellence is not an event but a habit.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Love is for life
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Treat life as if it is the best gift from the universe.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Negative actions cannot create a positive life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: For success, choice is more important than action.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Forgiveness is the best tonic for heart.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Invest in yourself to get the best interest.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When mankind is drowning in a multitude of problems, swimming is not the solution. The solution is reaching higher ground which is the ultimate salvation.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Love is a flower that grows in the garden of mind if we treat it with kindness, compassion, and joy.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: There is no right or wrong
author: he sings the deep songs of the soul silently.

quote: Your path should be lighted with love and trust, your purpose should be clear, and your goal should be the light post.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: He left her. She was dissatisfied with him. He had preferred to incur her anger rather than cause her pain. He had kept all the pain for himself.
author: Osayi Emokpae Lasisi, Because You Deserve Love

quote: Always – but especially when suffering - surround yourself with those who inspire you to lose yourself more honestly, to love others more thoroughly, to live life more fully, and to trust God more wholly. Huddle with those who care for you and those who are exemplary in their encouragement, patience and understanding of others. Hang out with those who strive to put God and faith at their center. Pray for peers, friends and mentors who will not only encourage you to be your best independent, strong, and vulnerable self all at the same time – but also sincerely humble. Pray that their angel dust will transcend you when even the smallest flecks of their contagious warmth and permeating beauty fall upon you. Then ever pray that you may have the opportunity to likewise ease and nurture others in such authentic ways; thus honing such a charitable, other-oriented nature of your own, – a miraculous healing balm – a buffer of pain if there ever was one. Know this is the most powerful antidote for fear and sorrow; the most effective – and addictive – cure-all known in all of creation; an elixir for that otherwise, elusive kind of happiness – the kind that weathers, endures and remains in all seasons and conditions.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: She wore her scarsas her best attire.A stunning dressmade of hellfire.
author: Mika Yamamori

quote: When some one use "You", in stead of "Us", It makes you cry, because in love whatever happens it need to be happen in both end, if its only "I" or "You" then the value of love becomes singular and everyone can feel or need to know, in LOVE singular never works......
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Truth is never a straight line; it is a circle that will take you back to what you know, in order to challenge your belief in what is fair, what is real, what is forgiveable, what is not and what type of person will you become today now that you know.
author: Io Sakisaka

quote: Pain in your past will become power in your future. So make suffering essential.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Be patient and endure the times.Your glorious days shall come to pass.
author: Angela ShahAnwar

quote: 2a.m and a ceiling stained with question marks.
author: Amy Engel, The Revolution of Ivy

quote: The pain of one human being to another cannot be translated through words and for that I am certain, it will never be truly experienced again.
author: Jaiendra Puri

quote: No one can understand your pain until they experience it. Stop trying to explain.
author: Joyce Wycoff

quote: The paint is drying, and time is dying. The pain is crying, lying on my back, trying to get back the time, to brushstrokes too fast, wet went dry and love went dull; now I live in a portrait I never painted.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Then dawns the Invisible; the Unseen its truth reveals;My outward sense is gone, my inward essence feels:Its wings are almost free--its home, its harbour found,Measuring the gulph, it stoops and dares the final bound,"Oh I dreadful is the check--intense the agony--When the ear begins to hear, and the eye begins to see;When the pulse begins to throb, the brain to think again;The soul to feel the flesh, and the flesh to feel the chain.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Pain too much to handle also comes with exquisite beauty, as common as dirt, as unexpected as grace.
author: Sontag, Susan

quote: I do believe God gave me a spark of genius, but he quenched it in misery.

quote: Rose lived the same life I did, but she doesn’t have PTSD. No bad dreams, no missing memories. Sometimes I’m jealous that she seems to deal with everything better than I do. But then I’ll catch her with this hollow look in her eyes and think maybe she just disguises everything for my benefit.Maybe she’s broken on the inside too.

quote: Independence is the recognition of the fact that yours is the responsibility of judgment and nothing can help you escape it—that no substitute can do your thinking—that the vilest form of self-abasement and self-destruction is the subordination of your mind to the mind of another, the acceptance of an authority over your brain, the acceptance of his assertions as facts, his say-so as truth, his edicts as middle-man between your consciousness and your existence.

quote: Know that blank pages feel the urge of the ink as much as tears paint a different pain, changes

However, ‘that’ someone will vanish from the scene once you begin to regain grip on your life, leaving you with another sense of loss to nurse.

You make a big big biiiiiig mistake not to ask God in prayer before choosing a wife /Husband AND RECEIVING A DEFINITE ANSWER FROM HIM.Are you still thinking "Unbeliever" means people who are not in the message church?Church was indeed a kaboooooooooom!

But now I have got the chance to recognize and deal with it more effectively and I know that I can visit this place as many times as I want, and take as many chances as I want, because I finally realize that I, am in total control of my life.

quote: That stunning fuckin’ smile. I ain’t ever seen you smile in the whole time you’ve been at the compound.”I lost my smile, then replied, “Because I do not have reason to smile very often.”Ky’s fingers began tracing the back of my hand. “Then you make a reason, Li. Don’t make excuses for living a shit life. It ain’t rocket science. You don’t like something, find something you do. Don’t like being around someone, stay the fuck away. Wanna change your life, then get off your ass, bitch and fuckin’ change it.

quote: Stand out from the crowd with the most up to date AnR Directory, A&R directory, AnR contacts, A&R contacts. How to signed to a label, Now easily connect with assistants to start your music career and become a good hip hop artist and how to make it in the music industry.

quote: When you play a piece of music there are so many different ways you could play it. You keep asking yourself what if. You try this and you say what if and you try that. When you buy a CD you get one answer to the question. You never get the what if.
